methods.name: getGeneratorForName
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to get the {@link ChunkGenerator} with the given name.

If the generator is not found, null will be returned and a message will be printed to the specified {@link CommandSender} explaining why.

The name must be in the "plugin:id" notation, or optionally just "plugin", where "plugin" is the safe-name of a plugin and "id" is an optional unique identifier for the generator you wish to request from the plugin.

parameters.name: world
parameters.comment_text: Name of the world this will be used for

parameters.name: name
parameters.comment_text: Name of the generator to retrieve

parameters.name: output
parameters.comment_text: Where to output if errors are present

methods.name: isInside

methods.name: spawn
methods.comment_text:
Spawn an entity of a specific class at the given {@link Location}, with the supplied function run before the entity is added to the world.
Note that when the function is run, the entity will not be actually in the world. Any operation involving such as teleporting the entity is undefined until after this function returns.

     {@link Entity} requested cannot be spawned

Spawn a {@link FallingBlock} entity at the given {@link Location} of the specified {@link Material}. The material dictates what is falling. When the FallingBlock hits the ground, it will place that block.

The Material must be a block type, check with {@link Material#isBlock() material.isBlock()}. The Material may not be air.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: The {@link Location} to spawn the FallingBlock

throws.name: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

     MaterialData} are null or {@link Material} of the {@link MaterialData} is not a block

methods.name: getTicksPerAnimalSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets the world's ticks per animal spawns value

This value determines how many ticks there are between attempts to spawn animals.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn animals in this world every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn animals in this world every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, animal spawning will be disabled for this world. We recommend using {@link #setSpawnFlags(boolean, boolean)} to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 400.

methods.name: setTicksPerAnimalSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Sets the world's ticks per animal spawns value

This value determines how many ticks there are between attempts to spawn animals.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn animals in this world every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn animals in this world every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, animal spawning will be disabled for this world. We recommend using {@link #setSpawnFlags(boolean, boolean)} to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 400.

parameters.name: ticksPerAnimalSpawns
parameters.comment_text:
the ticks per animal spawns value you want
     to set the world to

methods.name: getTicksPerMonsterSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets the world's ticks per monster spawns value

This value determines how many ticks there are between attempts to spawn monsters.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters in this world every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters in this world every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, monsters spawning will be disabled for this world. We recommend using {@link #setSpawnFlags(boolean, boolean)} to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 1.

methods.name: setTicksPerMonsterSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Sets the world's ticks per monster spawns value

This value determines how many ticks there are between attempts to spawn monsters.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters in this world on every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters in this world every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, monsters spawning will be disabled for this world. We recommend using {@link #setSpawnFlags(boolean, boolean)} to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 1.

parameters.name: ticksPerMonsterSpawns

This is solely meant for identifying methods that don't need to be overridden / handled manually.

classes.name: org.bukkit.UnsafeValues
classes.comment_text:
This interface provides value conversions that may be specific to a runtime, or have arbitrary meaning (read: magic values).

Their existence and behavior is not guaranteed across future versions. They may be poorly named, throw exceptions, have misleading parameters, or any other bad programming practice.

methods.name: loadAdvancement
methods.comment_text:
Load an advancement represented by the specified string into the server. The advancement format is governed by Minecraft and has no specified layout.
It is currently a JSON object, as described by the Minecraft Wiki: http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Advancements
Loaded advancements will be stored and persisted across server restarts and reloads.
Callers should be prepared for {@link Exception} to be thrown.

methods.name: removeAdvancement
methods.comment_text:
Delete an advancement which was loaded and saved by {@link #loadAdvancement(org.bukkit.NamespacedKey, java.lang.String)}.
This method will only remove advancement from persistent storage. It should be accompanied by a call to {@link Server#reloadData()} in order to fully remove it from the running instance.

classes.name: org.bukkit.TravelAgent
classes.comment_text:
The Travel Agent handles the creation and the research of Nether and End portals when Entities try to use one.

It is used in {@link org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityPortalEvent} and in {@link org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerPortalEvent} to help developers reproduce and/or modify Vanilla behaviour.

parameters.comment_text:
the radius in which to search for a portal from the
     location

methods.name: getSearchRadius

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment_text: the radius in which to create a portal from the location

methods.name: getCreationRadius

methods.name: getCanCreatePortal
methods.comment_text:
Returns whether the TravelAgent will attempt to create a destination
 portal or not.

methods.name: setCanCreatePortal
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether the TravelAgent should attempt to create a destination
 portal or not.

parameters.name: create
parameters.comment_text:
Sets whether the TravelAgent should create a destination
     portal or not

methods.name: findOrCreate
methods.comment_text:
Attempt to find a portal near the given location, if a portal is not
 found it will attempt to create one.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: the location where the search for a portal should begin

methods.name: findPortal
methods.comment_text: Attempt to find a portal near the given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: the desired location of the portal

methods.name: createPortal
methods.comment_text:
Attempt to create a portal near the given location.

In the case of a Nether portal teleportation, this will attempt to create a Nether portal.

In the case of an Ender portal teleportation, this will (re-)create the obsidian platform and clean blocks above it.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: the desired location of the portal

methods.name: getBukkitVersion

methods.name: getOnlinePlayers
methods.comment_text:
Gets a view of all currently logged in players. This {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) view} is a reused object, making some operations like {@link Collection#size()} zero-allocation.

The collection is a view backed by the internal representation, such that, changes to the internal state of the server will be reflected immediately. However, the reuse of the returned collection (identity) is not strictly guaranteed for future or all implementations. Casting the collection, or relying on interface implementations (like {@link Serializable} or {@link List}), is deprecated.

Iteration behavior is undefined outside of self-contained main-thread uses. Normal and immediate iterator use without consequences that affect the collection are fully supported. The effects following (non-exhaustive) {@link Entity#teleport(Location) teleportation}, {@link Player#setHealth(double) death}, and {@link Player#kickPlayer( String) kicking} are undefined. Any use of this collection from asynchronous threads is unsafe.

For safe consequential iteration or mimicking the old array behavior, using {@link Collection#toArray(Object[])} is recommended. For making snapshots, {@link ImmutableList#copyOf(Collection)} is recommended.

methods.name: getServerId

Get an ID of this server. The ID is a simple generally alphanumeric ID
 that can be used for uniquely identifying this server.

methods.name: broadcastMessage

Broadcast a message to all players.

This is the same as calling {@link #broadcast(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)} to {@link #BROADCAST_CHANNEL_USERS}

methods.name: getUpdateFolder
methods.comment_text:
Gets the name of the update folder. The update folder is used to safely update plugins at the right moment on a plugin load.

The update folder name is relative to the plugins folder.

methods.name: getUpdateFolderFile
methods.comment_text:
Gets the update folder. The update folder is used to safely update
 plugins at the right moment on a plugin load.

methods.name: getConnectionThrottle
methods.comment_text: Gets the value of the connection throttle setting.

methods.name: getTicksPerAnimalSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets default ticks per animal spawns value.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, animal spawning will be disabled. We recommend using spawn-animals to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 400.

methods.name: getTicksPerMonsterSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets the default ticks per monster spawns value.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, monsters spawning will be disabled. We recommend using spawn-monsters to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 1.

methods.name: createInventory
methods.comment_text:
Creates an empty inventory with the specified type and title. If the type is {@link InventoryType#CHEST}, the new inventory has a size of 27; otherwise the new inventory has the normal size for its type.
It should be noted that some inventory types do not support titles and may not render with said titles on the Minecraft client.
{@link InventoryType#WORKBENCH} will not process crafting recipes if created with this method. Use {@link Player#openWorkbench(Location, boolean)} instead.
{@link InventoryType#ENCHANTING} will not process {@link ItemStack}s for possible enchanting results. Use {@link Player#openEnchanting(Location, boolean)} instead.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.comment_text: the holder of the inventory, or null to indicate no holder

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment_text: the type of inventory to create

classes.name: org.bukkit.NamespacedKey
classes.comment_text:
Represents a String based key which consists of two components - a namespace and a key. Namespaces may only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, and hyphens.

Keys may only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, hyphens, and forward slashes.

constructors.name: NamespacedKey
constructors.comment_text: Create a key in a specific namespace.

constructors.name: NamespacedKey
constructors.comment_text:
Create a key in the plugin's namespace.

Namespaces may only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, and hyphens.

Keys may only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, hyphens, and forward slashes.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: the plugin to use for the namespace

fields.name: MINECRAFT
fields.comment_text: The namespace representing all inbuilt keys.

fields.name: BUKKIT
fields.comment_text:
The namespace representing all keys generated by Bukkit for backwards
 compatibility measures.

methods.name: randomKey
methods.comment_text: Return a new random key in the {@link #BUKKIT} namespace.

methods.name: minecraft
methods.comment_text: Get a key in the Minecraft namespace.

methods.name: getCustomName

Gets the custom name on a mob or block. If there is no name this method will return null.

This value has no effect on players, they will always use their real name.

methods.name: setCustomName
methods.comment_text:
Sets a custom name on a mob or block. This name will be used in death messages and can be sent to the client as a nameplate over the mob.

Setting the name to null or an empty string will clear it.

This value has no effect on players, they will always use their real name.

Checks if this Material can be interacted with.

 Interactable materials include those with functionality when they are
 interacted with by a player such as chests, furnaces, etc.

 Some blocks such as piston heads and stairs are considered interactable
 though may not perform any additional functionality.

 Note that the interactability of some materials may be dependant on their
 state as well. This method will return true if there is at least one
 state in which additional interact handling is performed for the
 material.

This number is used to calculate the time required to break each block.
Only available when {@link #isBlock()} is true.

Obtains the blast resistance value (also known as block "durability").
This value is used in explosions to calculate whether a block should be broken or not.
Only available when {@link #isBlock()} is true.

classes.name: org.bukkit.Location
classes.comment_text:
Represents a 3-dimensional position in a world.
No constraints are placed on any angular values other than that they be specified in degrees. This means that negative angles or angles of greater magnitude than 360 are valid, but may be normalized to any other equivalent representation by the implementation.

methods.name: setYaw
methods.comment_text:
Sets the yaw of this location, measured in degrees.
  • A yaw of 0 or 360 represents the positive z direction.
  • A yaw of 180 represents the negative z direction.
  • A yaw of 90 represents the negative x direction.
  • A yaw of 270 represents the positive x direction.
Increasing yaw values are the equivalent of turning to your right-facing, increasing the scale of the next respective axis, and decreasing the scale of the previous axis.

methods.name: getYaw
methods.comment_text:
Gets the yaw of this location, measured in degrees.
  • A yaw of 0 or 360 represents the positive z direction.
  • A yaw of 180 represents the negative z direction.
  • A yaw of 90 represents the negative x direction.
  • A yaw of 270 represents the positive x direction.
Increasing yaw values are the equivalent of turning to your right-facing, increasing the scale of the next respective axis, and decreasing the scale of the previous axis.

methods.name: setPitch
methods.comment_text:
Sets the pitch of this location, measured in degrees.
  • A pitch of 0 represents level forward facing.
  • A pitch of 90 represents downward facing, or negative y direction.
  • A pitch of -90 represents upward facing, or positive y direction.
Increasing pitch values the equivalent of looking down.

methods.name: getPitch
methods.comment_text:
Gets the pitch of this location, measured in degrees.
  • A pitch of 0 represents level forward facing.
  • A pitch of 90 represents downward facing, or negative y direction.
  • A pitch of -90 represents upward facing, or positive y direction.
Increasing pitch values the equivalent of looking down.

methods.name: getDirection
methods.comment_text:
Gets a unit-vector pointing in the direction that this Location is
 facing.

methods.name: setDirection
methods.comment_text:
Sets the {@link #getYaw() yaw} and {@link #getPitch() pitch} to point
 in the direction of the vector.

methods.name: add
methods.comment_text: Adds the location by another.

methods.name: add
methods.comment_text: Adds the location by a vector.

methods.name: add
methods.comment_text: Adds the location by another. Not world-aware.

methods.name: subtract
methods.comment_text: Subtracts the location by another.

methods.name: subtract
methods.comment_text: Subtracts the location by a vector.

methods.name: subtract
methods.comment_text:
Subtracts the location by another. Not world-aware and
 orientation independent.

methods.name: length
methods.comment_text:
Gets the magnitude of the location, defined as sqrt(x^2+y^2+z^2). The
 value of this method is not cached and uses a costly square-root
 function, so do not repeatedly call this method to get the location's
 magnitude. NaN will be returned if the inner result of the sqrt()
 function overflows, which will be caused if the length is too long. Not
 world-aware and orientation independent.

methods.name: lengthSquared
methods.comment_text:
Gets the magnitude of the location squared. Not world-aware and
 orientation independent.

methods.name: distance
methods.comment_text:
Get the distance between this location and another. The value of this
 method is not cached and uses a costly square-root function, so do not
 repeatedly call this method to get the location's magnitude. NaN will
 be returned if the inner result of the sqrt() function overflows, which
 will be caused if the distance is too long.

methods.name: distanceSquared
methods.comment_text: Get the squared distance between this location and another.

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment_text:
Performs scalar multiplication, multiplying all components with a
 scalar. Not world-aware.

methods.name: zero
methods.comment_text: Zero this location's components. Not world-aware.

methods.comment_text: Constructs a new {@link Vector} based on this Location

classes.name: org.bukkit.GameRule
classes.comment_text:
GameRules dictate certain behavior within Minecraft itself
For more information please visit the Minecraft Wiki

fields.name: ANNOUNCE_ADVANCEMENTS
fields.comment_text: Toggles the announcing of advancements.

fields.name: COMMAND_BLOCK_OUTPUT
fields.comment_text: Whether command blocks should notify admins when they perform commands.

fields.name: DISABLE_ELYTRA_MOVEMENT_CHECK
fields.comment_text:
Whether the server should skip checking player speed when the player is
 wearing elytra.

fields.name: DO_DAYLIGHT_CYCLE
fields.comment_text: Whether time progresses from the current moment.

fields.name: DO_ENTITY_DROPS
fields.comment_text: Whether entities that are not mobs should have drops.

fields.name: DO_FIRE_TICK
fields.comment_text: Whether fire should spread and naturally extinguish.

fields.name: DO_LIMITED_CRAFTING
fields.comment_text:
Whether players should only be able to craft recipes they've unlocked
 first.

fields.name: DO_MOB_LOOT
fields.comment_text: Whether mobs should drop items.

fields.name: DO_MOB_SPAWNING
fields.comment_text: Whether mobs should naturally spawn.

fields.name: DO_TILE_DROPS
fields.comment_text: Whether blocks should have drops.

fields.name: DO_WEATHER_CYCLE
fields.comment_text: Whether the weather will change from the current moment.

fields.name: KEEP_INVENTORY
fields.comment_text: Whether the player should keep items in their inventory after death.

fields.name: LOG_ADMIN_COMMANDS
fields.comment_text: Whether to log admin commands to server log.

fields.name: MOB_GRIEFING
fields.comment_text: Whether mobs can pick up items or change blocks.

fields.name: NATURAL_REGENERATION
fields.comment_text: Whether players can regenerate health naturally through their hunger bar.

fields.name: REDUCED_DEBUG_INFO
fields.comment_text: Whether the debug screen shows all or reduced information.

fields.name: SEND_COMMAND_FEEDBACK
fields.comment_text:
Whether the feedback from commands executed by a player should show up in
 chat. Also affects the default behavior of whether command blocks store
 their output text.

fields.name: SHOW_DEATH_MESSAGES
fields.comment_text: Whether a message appears in chat when a player dies.

fields.name: SPECTATORS_GENERATE_CHUNKS
fields.comment_text: Whether players in spectator mode can generate chunks.

fields.name: RANDOM_TICK_SPEED
fields.comment_text:
How often a random block tick occurs (such as plant growth, leaf decay,
 etc.) per chunk section per game tick. 0 will disable random ticks,
 higher numbers will increase random ticks.

fields.name: SPAWN_RADIUS
fields.comment_text:
The number of blocks outward from the world spawn coordinates that a
 player will spawn in when first joining a server or when dying without a
 spawnpoint.

fields.name: MAX_ENTITY_CRAMMING
fields.comment_text:
The maximum number of other pushable entities a mob or player can push, before taking suffocation damage.
Setting to 0 disables this rule.

fields.name: MAX_COMMAND_CHAIN_LENGTH
fields.comment_text:
Determines the number at which the chain of command blocks act as a "chain."
This is the maximum amount of command blocks that can be activated in a single tick from a single chain.

methods.name: getOnlinePlayers
methods.comment_text:
Gets a view of all currently logged in players. This {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) view} is a reused object, making some operations like {@link Collection#size()} zero-allocation.

The collection is a view backed by the internal representation, such that, changes to the internal state of the server will be reflected immediately. However, the reuse of the returned collection (identity) is not strictly guaranteed for future or all implementations. Casting the collection, or relying on interface implementations (like {@link Serializable} or {@link List}), is deprecated.

Iteration behavior is undefined outside of self-contained main-thread uses. Normal and immediate iterator use without consequences that affect the collection are fully supported. The effects following (non-exhaustive) {@link Entity#teleport(Location) teleportation}, {@link Player#setHealth(double) death}, and {@link Player#kickPlayer( String) kicking} are undefined. Any use of this collection from asynchronous threads is unsafe.

For safe consequential iteration or mimicking the old array behavior, using {@link Collection#toArray(Object[])} is recommended. For making snapshots, {@link ImmutableList#copyOf(Collection)} is recommended.

methods.name: getIp

The update folder name is relative to the plugins folder.

methods.name: getConnectionThrottle
methods.comment_text: Gets the value of the connection throttle setting.

methods.name: getTicksPerAnimalSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets default ticks per animal spawns value.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, animal spawning will be disabled. We recommend using spawn-animals to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 400.

methods.name: getTicksPerMonsterSpawns
methods.comment_text:
Gets the default ticks per monster spawns value.

Example Usage:

  • A value of 1 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every tick.
  • A value of 400 will mean the server will attempt to spawn monsters every 400th tick.
  • A value below 0 will be reset back to Minecraft's default.

Note: If set to 0, monsters spawning will be disabled. We recommend using spawn-monsters to control this instead.

Minecraft default: 1.

methods.name: createInventory
methods.comment_text:
Creates an empty inventory with the specified type and title. If the type is {@link InventoryType#CHEST}, the new inventory has a size of 27; otherwise the new inventory has the normal size for its type.
It should be noted that some inventory types do not support titles and may not render with said titles on the Minecraft client.
{@link InventoryType#WORKBENCH} will not process crafting recipes if created with this method. Use {@link Player#openWorkbench(Location, boolean)} instead.
{@link InventoryType#ENCHANTING} will not process {@link ItemStack}s for possible enchanting results. Use {@link Player#openEnchanting(Location, boolean)} instead.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.comment_text: the holder of the inventory, or null to indicate no holder

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment_text: the type of inventory to create

classes.name: org.bukkit.BanList.Type
classes.comment_text: Represents a ban-type that a {@link BanList} may track.

classes.name: org.bukkit.BanEntry
classes.comment_text:
A single entry from a ban list. This may represent either a player ban or an IP ban.

Ban entries include the following properties:
Property information
Property Description
Target Name / IP Address The target name or IP address
Creation Date The creation date of the ban
Source The source of the ban, such as a player, console, plugin, etc
Expiration Date The expiration date of the ban
Reason The reason for the ban

Unsaved information is not automatically written to the implementation's ban list, instead, the {@link #save()} method must be called to write the changes to the ban list. If this ban entry has expired (such as from an unban) and is no longer found in the list, the {@link #save()} call will re-add it to the list, therefore banning the victim specified.

Likewise, changes to the associated {@link BanList} or other entries may or may not be reflected in this entry.

methods.name: getTarget
methods.comment_text:
Gets the target involved. This may be in the form of an IP or a player
 name.

methods.comment_text: Gets the date this ban entry was created.

parameters.name: created
parameters.comment_text: the new created date, cannot be null

methods.name: getSource
methods.comment_text:
Gets the source of this ban.

Note: A source is considered any String, although this is generally a player name.

methods.name: setSource
methods.comment_text:
Sets the source of this ban.

Note: A source is considered any String, although this is generally a player name.

parameters.name: source
parameters.comment_text: the new source where null values become empty strings

methods.name: getExpiration

methods.name: setExpiration

Sets the date this ban expires on. Null values are considered

the new expiration date, or null to indicate an

methods.name: getReason

parameters.name: reason

     default

methods.name: save
methods.comment_text:
Saves the ban entry, overwriting any previous data in the ban list.

Saving the ban entry of an unbanned player will cause the player to be banned once again.

the {@link BlockVector} containing the relative origin

the {@link BlockVector} containing the size of this

While in {@link UsageMode#LOAD} mode this will ignore any entities that were saved to file.

methods.name: isBoundingBoxVisible

methods.name: setIntegrity
methods.comment_text:
Set the integrity of the structure. Integrity must be between 0.0 and 1.0
 Lower integrity values will result in more blocks being removed when
 loading a structure. Integrity and {@link #getSeed()} are used together
 to determine which blocks are randomly removed to mimic "decay."

methods.name: getIntegrity
methods.comment_text: Get the integrity of this structure.

methods.name: setSeed
methods.comment_text:
The seed used to determine which blocks will be removed upon loading.
 {@link #getIntegrity()} and seed are used together to determine which
 blocks are randomly removed to mimic "decay."

methods.name: getSeed
methods.comment_text:
The seed used to determine how many blocks are removed upon loading of
 this structure.

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.comment_text: Only applicable while in {@link UsageMode#DATA}. Metadata are specific functions that can be applied to the structure location. Consult the Minecraft wiki for more information.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.comment_text: the function to perform on the selected location

methods.name: getMetadata

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.Dropper
classes.comment_text: Represents a captured state of a dropper.

methods.name: drop
methods.comment_text:
Tries to drop a randomly selected item from the dropper's inventory, following the normal behavior of a dropper.

Normal behavior of a dropper is as follows:

If the block that the dropper is facing is an InventoryHolder, the randomly selected ItemStack is placed within that Inventory in the first slot that's available, starting with 0 and counting up. If the inventory is full, nothing happens.

If the block that the dropper is facing is not an InventoryHolder, the randomly selected ItemStack is dropped on the ground in the form of an {@link org.bukkit.entity.Item Item}.

If the block represented by this state is no longer a dropper, this will do nothing.

Gets the BlockProjectileSource object for the dispenser.

methods.name: dispense

Attempts to dispense the contents of the dispenser.

If the block represented by this state is no longer a dispenser, this will return false.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.DaylightDetector

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.CreatureSpawner
classes.comment_text: Represents a captured state of a creature spawner.

methods.name: getSpawnedType
methods.comment_text: Get the spawner's creature type.

methods.name: setSpawnedType
methods.comment_text: Set the spawner's creature type.

methods.name: setCreatureTypeByName
methods.comment_text: Set the spawner mob type.

methods.name: getCreatureTypeName
methods.comment_text: Get the spawner's creature type.

methods.name: getDelay
methods.comment_text:
Get the spawner's delay.
This is the delay, in ticks, until the spawner will spawn its next mob.

methods.name: setDelay
methods.comment_text:
Set the spawner's delay.
If set to -1, the spawn delay will be reset to a random value between {@link #getMinSpawnDelay} and {@link #getMaxSpawnDelay()}.

methods.name: getMinSpawnDelay
methods.comment_text:
The minimum spawn delay amount (in ticks).
This value is used when the spawner resets its delay (for any reason). It will choose a random number between {@link #getMinSpawnDelay()} and {@link #getMaxSpawnDelay()} for its next {@link #getDelay()}. Default value is 200 ticks.

methods.name: setMinSpawnDelay
methods.comment_text: Set the minimum spawn delay amount (in ticks).

methods.name: getMaxSpawnDelay
methods.comment_text:
The maximum spawn delay amount (in ticks).
This value is used when the spawner resets its delay (for any reason). It will choose a random number between {@link #getMinSpawnDelay()} and {@link #getMaxSpawnDelay()} for its next {@link #getDelay()}.
This value must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to {@link #getMaxSpawnDelay()}. Default value is 800 ticks.

methods.name: setMaxSpawnDelay
methods.comment_text:
Set the maximum spawn delay amount (in ticks).
This value must be greater than 0, as well as greater than or equal to {@link #getMinSpawnDelay()}

parameters.name: delay
parameters.comment_text: the new maximum spawn delay amount

methods.name: getSpawnCount
methods.comment_text:
Get how many mobs attempt to spawn.
Default value is 4.

methods.name: setSpawnCount
methods.comment_text: Set how many mobs attempt to spawn.

methods.name: getMaxNearbyEntities
methods.comment_text:
Set the new maximum amount of similar entities that are allowed to be within spawning range of this spawner.
If more than the maximum number of entities are within range, the spawner will not spawn and try again with a new {@link #getDelay()}.
Default value is 16.

methods.name: setMaxNearbyEntities
methods.comment_text:
Set the maximum number of similar entities that are allowed to be within spawning range of this spawner.
Similar entities are entities that are of the same {@link EntityType}

parameters.name: maxNearbyEntities
parameters.comment_text: the maximum number of nearby, similar, entities

methods.name: getRequiredPlayerRange
methods.comment_text:
Get the maximum distance(squared) a player can be in order for this spawner to be active.
If this value is less than or equal to 0, this spawner is always active (given that there are players online).
Default value is 16.

methods.name: setRequiredPlayerRange
methods.comment_text:
Set the maximum distance (squared) a player can be in order for this spawner to be active.
Setting this value to less than or equal to 0 will make this spawner always active (given that there are players online).

parameters.name: requiredPlayerRange
parameters.comment_text:
the maximum distance (squared) a player can be
 in order for this spawner to be active.

methods.name: getSpawnRange
methods.comment_text:
Get the radius around which the spawner will attempt to spawn mobs in.
This area is square, includes the block the spawner is in, and is centered on the spawner's x,z coordinates - not the spawner itself.
It is 2 blocks high, centered on the spawner's y-coordinate (its bottom); thus allowing mobs to spawn as high as its top surface and as low as 1 block below its bottom surface.
Default value is 4.

methods.name: setSpawnRange
methods.comment_text: Set the new spawn range.

methods.comment_text:
Gets the captured inventory snapshot of this container.

The returned inventory is not linked to any block. Any modifications to the returned inventory will not be applied to the block represented by this block state up until {@link #update(boolean, boolean)} has been called.

Gets the name of this CommandBlock.  The name is used with commands

If the block was changed to a different type in the meantime, the returned inventory might no longer be valid.

If this block state is not placed this will return the captured inventory snapshot instead.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.BlockState
classes.comment_text:
Represents a captured state of a block, which will not change automatically.

Unlike Block, which only one object can exist per coordinate, BlockState can exist multiple times for any given Block. Note that another plugin may change the state of the block and you will not know, or they may change the block to another type entirely, causing your BlockState to become invalid.

methods.name: getBlock
methods.comment_text: Gets the block represented by this block state.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment_text: Gets the metadata for this block state.

methods.name: getBlockData
methods.comment_text: Gets the data for this block state.

methods.name: getType
methods.comment_text: Gets the type of this block state.

methods.name: getLightLevel
methods.comment_text: Gets the current light level of the block represented by this block state.

methods.name: getWorld
methods.comment_text: Gets the world which contains the block represented by this block state.

methods.name: getX
methods.comment_text: Gets the x-coordinate of this block state.

methods.name: getY
methods.comment_text: Gets the y-coordinate of this block state.

methods.name: getZ
methods.comment_text: Gets the z-coordinate of this block state.

methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment_text:
Gets the location of this block state.

If this block state is not placed the location's world will be null!

methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment_text:
Stores the location of this block state in the provided Location object.

If the provided Location is null this method does nothing and returns null.

If this block state is not placed the location's world will be null!

methods.name: getChunk
methods.comment_text: Gets the chunk which contains the block represented by this block state.

methods.name: setData
methods.comment_text: Sets the metadata for this block state.

methods.name: setBlockData
methods.comment_text: Sets the data for this block state.

methods.name: setType
methods.comment_text: Sets the type of this block state.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment_text: Material to change this block state to

methods.name: update
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to update the block represented by this state, setting it to the new values as defined by this state.

This has the same effect as calling update(false). That is to say, this will not modify the state of a block if it is no longer the same type as it was when this state was taken. It will return false in this eventuality.

methods.name: update
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to update the block represented by this state, setting it to the new values as defined by this state.

This has the same effect as calling update(force, true). That is to say, this will trigger a physics update to surrounding blocks.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text: true to forcefully set the state

methods.name: update
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to update the block represented by this state, setting it to the new values as defined by this state.

If this state is not placed, this will have no effect and return true.

Unless force is true, this will not modify the state of a block if it is no longer the same type as it was when this state was taken. It will return false in this eventuality.

If force is true, it will set the type of the block to match the new state, set the state data and then return true.

If applyPhysics is true, it will trigger a physics update on surrounding blocks which could cause them to update or disappear.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text: true to forcefully set the state

parameters.name: applyPhysics
parameters.comment_text:
false to cancel updating physics on surrounding
     blocks

parameters.name: data
parameters.comment_text: The new data value for the block.

methods.name: isPlaced
methods.comment_text:
Returns whether this state is placed in the world.

Some methods will not work if the block state isn't placed in the world.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.Block
classes.comment_text:
Represents a block. This is a live object, and only one Block may exist for any given location in a world. The state of the block may change concurrently to your own handling of it; use block.getState() to get a snapshot state of a block which will not be modified.
Note that parts of this class which require access to the world at large (i.e. lighting and power) may not be able to be safely accessed during world generation when used in cases like BlockPhysicsEvent!!!!

Captures the current state of this block. You may then cast that state into any accepted type, such as Furnace or Sign.

The returned object will never be updated, and you are not guaranteed that (for example) a sign is still a sign after you capture its state.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.Beacon
classes.comment_text: Represents a captured state of a beacon.

methods.name: getEntitiesInRange
methods.comment_text:
Returns the list of players within the beacon's range of effect.

This will return an empty list if the block represented by this state is no longer a beacon.

methods.name: getTier
methods.comment_text:
Returns the tier of the beacon pyramid (0-4). The tier refers to the
 beacon's power level, based on how many layers of blocks are in the
 pyramid. Tier 1 refers to a beacon with one layer of 9 blocks under it.

methods.name: getPrimaryEffect
methods.comment_text: Returns the primary effect set on the beacon

methods.name: setPrimaryEffect
methods.comment_text: Set the primary effect on this beacon, or null to clear.

methods.name: getSecondaryEffect
methods.comment_text: Returns the secondary effect set on the beacon.

methods.name: setSecondaryEffect
methods.comment_text:
Set the secondary effect on this beacon, or null to clear. Note that tier
 must be >= 4 for this effect to be active.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.Banner

methods.name: getBaseColor

methods.name: setBaseColor
methods.comment_text: Sets the base color for this banner. Only valid for shield pseudo banners, otherwise base depends on block type

methods.name: getPatterns
methods.comment_text: Returns a list of patterns on this banner

methods.name: setPatterns
methods.comment_text: Sets the patterns used on this banner

methods.name: addPattern
methods.comment_text:
Adds a new pattern on top of the existing
 patterns

methods.name: getPattern
methods.comment_text: Returns the pattern at the specified index

methods.name: removePattern
methods.comment_text: Removes the pattern at the specified index

methods.name: setPattern
methods.comment_text: Sets the pattern at the specified index

methods.name: numberOfPatterns
methods.comment_text:
Returns the number of patterns on this
 banner

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.data.MultipleFacing
classes.comment_text:
This class encompasses the 'north', 'east', 'south', 'west', 'up', 'down' boolean flags which are used to set which faces of the block textures are displayed on.
Some blocks may not be able to have faces on all directions, use {@link #getAllowedFaces()} to get all possible faces for this block.

methods.comment_text: Checks if this block has the specified face enabled.

methods.name: setFace
methods.comment_text: Set whether this block has the specified face enabled.

methods.name: getFaces

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.data.Lightable

methods.name: setLit
methods.comment_text: Sets the value of the 'lit' property.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.data.Levelled
classes.comment_text:
'level' represents the amount of fluid contained within this block, either by itself or inside a cauldron.
In the case of water and lava blocks the levels have special meanings: a level of 0 corresponds to a source block, 1-7 regular fluid heights, and 8-15 to "falling" fluids. All falling fluids have the same behaviour, but the level corresponds to that of the block above them, equal to this.level - 8
May not be higher than {@link #getMaximumLevel()}.

methods.name: getLevel
methods.comment_text: Gets the value of the 'level' property.

methods.name: setLevel
methods.comment_text: Sets the value of the 'level' property.

methods.name: getMaximumLevel
methods.comment_text: Gets the maximum allowed value of the 'level' property.

classes.name: org.bukkit.block.data.Directional
classes.comment_text:
'facing' represents the face towards which the block is pointing.
Some blocks may not be able to face in all directions, use {@link #getFaces()} to get all possible directions for this block.

methods.name: getFacing
methods.comment_text: Gets the value of the 'facing' property.

methods.name: setFacing
methods.comment_text: Sets the value of the 'facing' property.

methods.name: getFaces
methods.comment_text: Gets the faces which are applicable to this block.

methods.name: getMaterial
methods.comment_text: Get the Material represented by this block data.

methods.name: getAsString
methods.comment_text:
Gets a string, which when passed into a method such as
 {@link Server#createBlockData(java.lang.String)} will unambiguously
 recreate this instance.

methods.name: merge
methods.comment_text:
Merges all explicitly set states from the given data with this BlockData.
Note that the given data MUST have been created from one of the String parse methods, e.g. {@link Server#createBlockData(java.lang.String)} and not have been subsequently modified.
Note also that the block types must match identically.

methods.name: matches
methods.comment_text:
Checks if the specified BlockData matches this block data.
The semantics of this method are such that for manually created or modified BlockData it has the same effect as {@link Object#equals(java.lang.Object)}, whilst for parsed data (that to which {@link #merge(org.bukkit.block.data.BlockData)} applies, it will return true when the type and all explicitly set states match.
Note that these semantics mean that a.matches(b) may not be the same as b.matches(a)

parameters.name: data
parameters.comment_text: the data to match against (normally a parsed constant)

methods.name: clone
methods.comment_text: Returns a copy of this BlockData.

     partial argument to be completed and command label

classes.name: org.bukkit.command.PluginIdentifiableCommand
classes.comment_text:
This interface is used by the help system to group commands into
 sub-indexes based on the {@link Plugin} they are a part of. Custom command
 implementations will need to implement this interface to have a sub-index
 automatically generated on the plugin's behalf.

methods.name: setTabCompleter
methods.comment_text:
Sets the {@link TabCompleter} to run when tab-completing this command.

If no TabCompleter is specified, and the command's executor implements TabCompleter, then the executor will be used for tab completion.

methods.name: getTabCompleter
methods.comment_text: Gets the {@link TabCompleter} associated with this command.

methods.name: getPlugin
methods.comment_text: Gets the owner of this PluginCommand

methods.name: tabComplete
methods.comment_text:
{@inheritDoc}

Delegates to the tab completer if present.

If it is not present or returns null, will delegate to the current command executor if it implements {@link TabCompleter}. If a non-null list has not been found, will default to standard player name completion in {@link Command#tabComplete(CommandSender, String, String[])}.

This method does not consider permissions.

throws.name: org.bukkit.command.CommandException
throws.comment_text:
if the completer or executor throw an
     exception during the process of tab-completing.

throws.name: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
throws.comment_text: if sender, alias, or args is null

methods.name: registerAll
methods.comment_text:
Registers all the commands belonging to a certain plugin.

Caller can use:-

  • command.getName() to determine the label registered for this command
  • command.getAliases() to determine the aliases which where registered

parameters.name: fallbackPrefix
parameters.comment_text:
a prefix which is prepended to each command with
     a ':' one or more times to make the command unique

parameters.name: commands
parameters.comment_text: a list of commands to register

methods.name: register
methods.comment_text:
Registers a command. Returns true on success; false if name is already taken and fallback had to be used.

Caller can use:-

  • command.getName() to determine the label registered for this command
  • command.getAliases() to determine the aliases which where registered

parameters.name: label
parameters.comment_text: the label of the command, without the '/'-prefix.

parameters.name: fallbackPrefix
parameters.comment_text:
a prefix which is prepended to the command with a
     ':' one or more times to make the command unique

methods.comment_text:
Tests the given {@link CommandSender} to see if they can perform this command.

If they do not have permission, they will be informed that they cannot do this.

methods.name: testPermissionSilent
methods.comment_text:
Tests the given {@link CommandSender} to see if they can perform this command.

No error is sent to the sender.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.MemorySection
classes.comment_text: A type of {@link ConfigurationSection} that is stored in memory.

constructors.name: MemorySection
MemorySection
constructors.comment_text: Creates an empty MemorySection with the specified parent and path.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.comment_text: Parent section that contains this own section.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text:
Path that you may access this section from via the root
     {@link Configuration}.

methods.name: createPath
methods.comment_text:
Creates a full path to the given {@link ConfigurationSection} from its root {@link Configuration}.

You may use this method for any given {@link ConfigurationSection}, not only {@link MemorySection}.

parameters.name: section
parameters.comment_text: Section to create a path for.

methods.name: createPath
methods.comment_text:
Creates a relative path to the given {@link ConfigurationSection} from the given relative section.

You may use this method for any given {@link ConfigurationSection}, not only {@link MemorySection}.

parameters.name: section
parameters.comment_text: Section to create a path for.

parameters.name: relativeTo
parameters.comment_text: Section to create the path relative to.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.MemoryConfigurationOptions
classes.comment_text:
Various settings for controlling the input and output of a {@link
 MemoryConfiguration}

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.MemoryConfiguration
classes.comment_text:
This is a {@link Configuration} implementation that does not save or load
 from any source, and stores all values in memory only.
 This is useful for temporary Configurations for providing defaults.

constructors.name: MemoryConfiguration
constructors.comment_text: Creates an empty {@link MemoryConfiguration} with no default values.

constructors.name: MemoryConfiguration
constructors.comment_text:
Creates an empty {@link MemoryConfiguration} using the specified {@link
 Configuration} as a source for all default values.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection
classes.comment_text: Represents a section of a {@link Configuration}

methods.name: getKeys
methods.comment_text:
Gets a set containing all keys in this section.

If deep is set to true, then this will contain all the keys within any child {@link ConfigurationSection}s (and their children, etc). These will be in a valid path notation for you to use.

If deep is set to false, then this will contain only the keys of any direct children, and not their own children.

parameters.name: deep
parameters.comment_text:
Whether or not to get a deep list, as opposed to a shallow
     list.

methods.name: getValues
methods.comment_text:
Gets a Map containing all keys and their values for this section.

If deep is set to true, then this will contain all the keys and values within any child {@link ConfigurationSection}s (and their children, etc). These keys will be in a valid path notation for you to use.

If deep is set to false, then this will contain only the keys and values of any direct children, and not their own children.

parameters.name: deep
parameters.comment_text:
Whether or not to get a deep list, as opposed to a shallow
     list.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment_text:
Checks if this {@link ConfigurationSection} contains the given path.

If the value for the requested path does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will return true.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment_text:
Checks if this {@link ConfigurationSection} contains the given path.

If the value for the requested path does not exist, the boolean parameter of true has been specified, a default value for the path exists, this will return true.

If a boolean parameter of false has been specified, true will only be returned if there is a set value for the specified path.

parameters.name: ignoreDefault
parameters.comment_text:
Whether or not to ignore if a default value for the
 specified path exists.

methods.name: isSet
methods.comment_text:
Checks if this {@link ConfigurationSection} has a value set for the given path.

If the value for the requested path does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will still return false.

methods.name: getCurrentPath
methods.comment_text:
Gets the path of this {@link ConfigurationSection} from its root {@link Configuration}

For any {@link Configuration} themselves, this will return an empty string.

If the section is no longer contained within its root for any reason, such as being replaced with a different value, this may return null.

To retrieve the single name of this section, that is, the final part of the path returned by this method, you may use {@link #getName()}.

methods.name: getName
methods.comment_text:
Gets the name of this individual {@link ConfigurationSection}, in the path.

This will always be the final part of {@link #getCurrentPath()}, unless the section is orphaned.

methods.name: getRoot
methods.comment_text:
Gets the root {@link Configuration} that contains this {@link ConfigurationSection}

For any {@link Configuration} themselves, this will return its own object.

If the section is no longer contained within its root for any reason, such as being replaced with a different value, this may return null.

methods.name: getParent
methods.comment_text:
Gets the parent {@link ConfigurationSection} that directly contains this {@link ConfigurationSection}.

For any {@link Configuration} themselves, this will return null.

If the section is no longer contained within its parent for any reason, such as being replaced with a different value, this may return null.

methods.name: get
methods.comment_text:
Gets the requested Object by path.

If the Object does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will return the default value. If the Object does not exist and no default value was specified, this will return null.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the Object to get.

methods.name: get
methods.comment_text:
Gets the requested Object by path, returning a default value if not found.

If the Object does not exist then the specified default value will returned regardless of if a default has been identified in the root {@link Configuration}.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the Object to get.

parameters.name: def
parameters.comment_text: The default value to return if the path is not found.

methods.name: set
methods.comment_text:
Sets the specified path to the given value.

If value is null, the entry will be removed. Any existing entry will be replaced, regardless of what the new value is.

Some implementations may have limitations on what you may store. See their individual javadocs for details. No implementations should allow you to store {@link Configuration}s or {@link ConfigurationSection}s, please use {@link #createSection(java.lang.String)} for that.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the object to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: New value to set the path to.

methods.name: createSection
methods.comment_text:
Creates an empty {@link ConfigurationSection} at the specified path.

Any value that was previously set at this path will be overwritten. If the previous value was itself a {@link ConfigurationSection}, it will be orphaned.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path to create the section at.

methods.name: createSection
methods.comment_text:
Creates a {@link ConfigurationSection} at the specified path, with specified values.

Any value that was previously set at this path will be overwritten. If the previous value was itself a {@link ConfigurationSection}, it will be orphaned.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path to create the section at.

methods.name: getString
methods.comment_text:
Gets the requested String by path.

If the String does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will return the default value. If the String does not exist and no default value was specified, this will return null.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the String to get.

methods.name: getString
methods.comment_text:
Gets the requested String by path, returning a default value if not found.

If the String does not exist then the specified default value will returned regardless of if a default has been identified in the root {@link Configuration}.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the String to get.

parameters.name: def

The default value to return if the path is not found or is
     not a String.

methods.name: isString
methods.comment_text:
Checks if the specified path is a String.

If the path exists but is not a String, this will return false. If the path does not exist, this will return false. If the path does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will check if that default value is a String and return appropriately.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the String to check.

methods.name: getStringList
methods.comment_text:
Gets the requested List of String by path.

If the List does not exist but a default value has been specified, this will return the default value. If the List does not exist and no default value was specified, this will return an empty List.

This method will attempt to cast any values into a String if possible, but may miss any values out if they are not compatible.

parameters.name: path

methods.name: getIntegerList

methods.name: getDefaultSection
methods.comment_text:
Gets the equivalent {@link ConfigurationSection} from the default {@link Configuration} defined in {@link #getRoot()}.

If the root contains no defaults, or the defaults doesn't contain a value for this path, or the value at this path is not a {@link ConfigurationSection} then this will return null.

methods.name: addDefault
methods.comment_text:
Sets the default value in the root at the given path as provided.

If no source {@link Configuration} was provided as a default collection, then a new {@link MemoryConfiguration} will be created to hold the new default value.

If value is null, the value will be removed from the default Configuration source.

If the value as returned by {@link #getDefaultSection()} is null, then this will create a new section at the path, replacing anything that may have existed there previously.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the value to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: Value to set the default to.

 Configuration}

methods.name: configuration
methods.comment_text: Returns the {@link Configuration} that this object is responsible for.

methods.name: pathSeparator
methods.comment_text:
Gets the char that will be used to separate {@link ConfigurationSection}s

This value does not affect how the {@link Configuration} is stored, only in how you access the data. The default value is '.'.

methods.name: pathSeparator
methods.comment_text:
Sets the char that will be used to separate {@link ConfigurationSection}s

This value does not affect how the {@link Configuration} is stored, only in how you access the data. The default value is '.'.

methods.name: copyDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Checks if the {@link Configuration} should copy values from its default {@link Configuration} directly.

If this is true, all values in the default Configuration will be directly copied, making it impossible to distinguish between values that were set and values that are provided by default. As a result, {@link ConfigurationSection#contains(java.lang.String)} will always return the same value as {@link ConfigurationSection#isSet(java.lang.String)}. The default value is false.

methods.name: copyDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Sets if the {@link Configuration} should copy values from its default {@link Configuration} directly.

If this is true, all values in the default Configuration will be directly copied, making it impossible to distinguish between values that were set and values that are provided by default. As a result, {@link ConfigurationSection#contains(java.lang.String)} will always return the same value as {@link ConfigurationSection#isSet(java.lang.String)}. The default value is false.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: Whether or not defaults are directly copied

classes.comment_text: Represents a source of configurable options and settings

methods.comment_text:
Sets the default value of the given path as provided.

If no source {@link Configuration} was provided as a default collection, then a new {@link MemoryConfiguration} will be created to hold the new default value.

If value is null, the value will be removed from the default Configuration source.

parameters.name: path
parameters.comment_text: Path of the value to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: Value to set the default to.

methods.name: addDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Sets the default values of the given paths as provided.

If no source {@link Configuration} was provided as a default collection, then a new {@link MemoryConfiguration} will be created to hold the new default values.

parameters.name: defaults
parameters.comment_text: A map of Path{@literal ->}Values to add to defaults.

methods.name: addDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Sets the default values of the given paths as provided.

If no source {@link Configuration} was provided as a default collection, then a new {@link MemoryConfiguration} will be created to hold the new default value.

This method will not hold a reference to the specified Configuration, nor will it automatically update if that Configuration ever changes. If you require this, you should set the default source with {@link #setDefaults(org.bukkit.configuration.Configuration)}.

parameters.name: defaults
parameters.comment_text: A configuration holding a list of defaults to copy.

methods.name: setDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Sets the source of all default values for this {@link Configuration}.

If a previous source was set, or previous default values were defined, then they will not be copied to the new source.

parameters.name: defaults
parameters.comment_text: New source of default values for this configuration.

methods.name: getDefaults
methods.comment_text:
Gets the source {@link Configuration} for this configuration.

If no configuration source was set, but default values were added, then a {@link MemoryConfiguration} will be returned. If no source was set and no defaults were set, then this method will return null.

methods.name: options
methods.comment_text:
Gets the {@link ConfigurationOptions} for this {@link Configuration}.

All setters through this method are chainable.

Various settings for controlling the input and output of a {@link
 YamlConfiguration}

methods.name: indent
methods.comment_text:
Gets how much spaces should be used to indent each line.

The minimum value this may be is 2, and the maximum is 9.

methods.name: indent

The minimum value this may be is 2, and the maximum is 9.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration
classes.comment_text:
An implementation of {@link Configuration} which saves all files in Yaml.
 Note that this implementation is not synchronized.

methods.name: loadConfiguration
methods.comment_text:
Creates a new {@link YamlConfiguration}, loading from the given file.

Any errors loading the Configuration will be logged and then ignored. If the specified input is not a valid config, a blank config will be returned.

The encoding used may follow the system dependent default.

methods.name: loadConfiguration
methods.comment_text:
Creates a new {@link YamlConfiguration}, loading from the given reader.

Any errors loading the Configuration will be logged and then ignored. If the specified input is not a valid config, a blank config will be returned.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.file.FileConfigurationOptions
classes.comment_text:
Various settings for controlling the input and output of a {@link
 FileConfiguration}

methods.name: header
methods.comment_text:
Gets the header that will be applied to the top of the saved output.

This header will be commented out and applied directly at the top of the generated output of the {@link FileConfiguration}. It is not required to include a newline at the end of the header as it will automatically be applied, but you may include one if you wish for extra spacing.

Null is a valid value which will indicate that no header is to be applied. The default value is null.

methods.name: header
methods.comment_text:
Sets the header that will be applied to the top of the saved output.

This header will be commented out and applied directly at the top of the generated output of the {@link FileConfiguration}. It is not required to include a newline at the end of the header as it will automatically be applied, but you may include one if you wish for extra spacing.

Null is a valid value which will indicate that no header is to be applied.

methods.name: copyHeader
methods.comment_text:
Gets whether or not the header should be copied from a default source.

If this is true, if a default {@link FileConfiguration} is passed to {@link FileConfiguration#setDefaults(org.bukkit.configuration.Configuration)} then upon saving it will use the header from that config, instead of the one provided here.

If no default is set on the configuration, or the default is not of type FileConfiguration, or that config has no header ({@link #header()} returns null) then the header specified in this configuration will be used.

Defaults to true.

methods.name: copyHeader
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether or not the header should be copied from a default source.

If this is true, if a default {@link FileConfiguration} is passed to {@link FileConfiguration#setDefaults(org.bukkit.configuration.Configuration)} then upon saving it will use the header from that config, instead of the one provided here.

If no default is set on the configuration, or the default is not of type FileConfiguration, or that config has no header ({@link #header()} returns null) then the header specified in this configuration will be used.

Defaults to true.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: Whether or not to copy the header

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.file.FileConfiguration

This is a base class for all File based implementations of {@link
 Configuration}

constructors.name: FileConfiguration

constructors.name: FileConfiguration
constructors.comment_text:
Creates an empty {@link FileConfiguration} using the specified {@link
 Configuration} as a source for all default values.

methods.name: save
methods.comment_text:
Saves this {@link FileConfiguration} to the specified location.

If the file does not exist, it will be created. If already exists, it will be overwritten. If it cannot be overwritten or created, an exception will be thrown.

This method will save using the system default encoding, or possibly using UTF8.

throws.name: java.io.IOException
throws.comment_text:
Thrown when the given file cannot be written to for
     any reason.

methods.name: load
methods.comment_text:
Loads this {@link FileConfiguration} from the specified location.

All the values contained within this configuration will be removed, leaving only settings and defaults, and the new values will be loaded from the given file.

If the file cannot be loaded for any reason, an exception will be thrown.

Thrown when the given file cannot be
     opened.

Thrown when the given file is not
     a valid Configuration.

Loads this {@link FileConfiguration} from the specified string, as opposed to from file.

All the values contained within this configuration will be removed, leaving only settings and defaults, and the new values will be loaded from the given string.

If the string is invalid in any way, an exception will be thrown.

Thrown if the specified string is
     invalid.

methods.name: buildHeader
methods.comment_text:
Compiles the header for this {@link FileConfiguration} and returns the result.

This will use the header from {@link #options()} -> {@link FileConfigurationOptions#header()}, respecting the rules of {@link FileConfigurationOptions#copyHeader()} if set.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.SerializableAs
classes.comment_text:
Represents an "alias" that a {@link ConfigurationSerializable} may be stored as. If this is not present on a {@link ConfigurationSerializable} class, it will use the fully qualified name of the class.

This value will be stored in the configuration so that the configuration deserialization can determine what type it is.

Using this annotation on any other class than a {@link ConfigurationSerializable} will have no effect.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.DelegateDeserialization
classes.comment_text:
Applies to a {@link ConfigurationSerializable} that will delegate all
 deserialization to another {@link ConfigurationSerializable}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerialization
classes.comment_text: Utility class for storing and retrieving classes for {@link Configuration}.

methods.name: deserializeObject
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to deserialize the given arguments into a new instance of the given class.

The class must implement {@link ConfigurationSerializable}, including the extra methods as specified in the javadoc of ConfigurationSerializable.

If a new instance could not be made, an example being the class not fully implementing the interface, null will be returned.

methods.name: deserializeObject
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to deserialize the given arguments into a new instance of the given class.

The class must implement {@link ConfigurationSerializable}, including the extra methods as specified in the javadoc of ConfigurationSerializable.

If a new instance could not be made, an example being the class not fully implementing the interface, null will be returned.

methods.name: registerClass
methods.comment_text:
Registers the given {@link ConfigurationSerializable} class by its
 alias

methods.name: registerClass
methods.comment_text:
Registers the given alias to the specified {@link
 ConfigurationSerializable} class

methods.name: unregisterClass
methods.comment_text: Unregisters the specified alias to a {@link ConfigurationSerializable}

methods.name: unregisterClass
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters any aliases for the specified {@link
 ConfigurationSerializable} class

methods.name: getClassByAlias
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to get a registered {@link ConfigurationSerializable} class by
 its alias

methods.name: getAlias
methods.comment_text:
Gets the correct alias for the given {@link ConfigurationSerializable}
 class

classes.name: org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerializable
classes.comment_text:
Represents an object that may be serialized.

These objects MUST implement one of the following, in addition to the methods as defined by this interface:

  • A static method "deserialize" that accepts a single {@link Map}< {@link String}, {@link Object}> and returns the class.
  • A static method "valueOf" that accepts a single {@link Map}<{@link String}, {@link Object}> and returns the class.
  • A constructor that accepts a single {@link Map}<{@link String}, {@link Object}>.
In addition to implementing this interface, you must register the class with {@link ConfigurationSerialization#registerClass(Class)}.

methods.name: serialize
methods.comment_text:
Creates a Map representation of this class.

This class must provide a method to restore this class, as defined in the {@link ConfigurationSerializable} interface javadocs.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.ValidatingPrompt
classes.comment_text:
ValidatingPrompt is the base class for any prompt that requires validation.
 ValidatingPrompt will keep replaying the prompt text until the user enters
 a valid response.

methods.name: acceptInput
methods.comment_text:
Accepts and processes input from the user and validates it. If
 validation fails, this prompt is returned for re-execution, otherwise
 the next Prompt in the prompt graph is returned.

parameters.name: input
parameters.comment_text: The input text from the user.

methods.name: blocksForInput
methods.comment_text: Ensures that the prompt waits for the user to provide input.

methods.name: isInputValid
methods.comment_text: Override this method to check the validity of the player's input.

methods.name: acceptValidatedInput
methods.comment_text:
Override this method to accept and processes the validated input from
 the user. Using the input, the next Prompt in the prompt graph should
 be returned.

parameters.name: input
parameters.comment_text: The validated input text from the user.

methods.name: getFailedValidationText
methods.comment_text:
Optionally override this method to display an additional message if the
 user enters an invalid input.

parameters.name: invalidInput
parameters.comment_text: The invalid input provided by the user.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.StringPrompt
classes.comment_text:
StringPrompt is the base class for any prompt that accepts an arbitrary
 string from the user.

methods.name: blocksForInput
methods.comment_text: Ensures that the prompt waits for the user to provide input.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.RegexPrompt
classes.comment_text:
RegexPrompt is the base class for any prompt that requires an input
 validated by a regular expression.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.Prompt
classes.comment_text:
A Prompt is the main constituent of a {@link Conversation}. Each prompt
 displays text to the user and optionally waits for a user's response.
 Prompts are chained together into a directed graph that represents the
 conversation flow. To halt a conversation, END_OF_CONVERSATION is returned
 in liu of another Prompt object.

fields.name: END_OF_CONVERSATION
fields.comment_text: A convenience constant for indicating the end of a conversation.

methods.name: getPromptText
methods.comment_text:
Gets the text to display to the user when this prompt is first
 presented.

methods.name: blocksForInput
methods.comment_text:
Checks to see if this prompt implementation should wait for user input
 or immediately display the next prompt.

methods.name: acceptInput
methods.comment_text:
Accepts and processes input from the user. Using the input, the next
 Prompt in the prompt graph is returned.

parameters.name: input
parameters.comment_text: The input text from the user.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.PluginNameConversationPrefix
classes.comment_text:
PluginNameConversationPrefix is a {@link ConversationPrefix} implementation
 that displays the plugin name in front of conversation output.

methods.name: getPrefix
methods.comment_text: Prepends each conversation message with the plugin name.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.PlayerNamePrompt

PlayerNamePrompt is the base class for any prompt that requires the player
 to enter another player's name.

methods.name: acceptValidatedInput
methods.comment_text:
Override this method to perform some action with the user's player name
 response.

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.NumericPrompt
classes.comment_text:
NumericPrompt is the base class for any prompt that requires a {@link
 Number} response from the user.

methods.name: isNumberValid
methods.comment_text:
Override this method to do further validation on the numeric player
 input after the input has been determined to actually be a number.

methods.name: acceptValidatedInput
methods.comment_text:
Override this method to perform some action with the user's integer
 response.

parameters.name: input
parameters.comment_text: The user's response as a {@link Number}.

methods.name: getInputNotNumericText
methods.comment_text:
Optionally override this method to display an additional message if the
 user enters an invalid number.

parameters.name: invalidInput
parameters.comment_text: The invalid input provided by the user.

methods.name: getFailedValidationText
methods.comment_text:

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.ConversationFactory
classes.comment_text:
A ConversationFactory is responsible for creating a {@link Conversation} from a predefined template. A ConversationFactory is typically created when a plugin is instantiated and builds a Conversation each time a user initiates a conversation with the plugin. Each Conversation maintains its own state and calls back as needed into the plugin.

The ConversationFactory implements a fluid API, allowing parameters to be set as an extension to the constructor.

Sets the modality of all {@link Conversation}s created by this factory. If a conversation is modal, all messages directed to the player are suppressed for the duration of the conversation.

The default is True.

The default is a {@link NullConversationPrefix};

The default is 600 seconds (5 minutes).

classes.name: org.bukkit.conversations.Conversation
classes.comment_text:
The Conversation class is responsible for tracking the current state of a conversation, displaying prompts to the user, and dispatching the user's response to the appropriate place. Conversation objects are not typically instantiated directly. Instead a {@link ConversationFactory} is used to construct identical conversations on demand.

Conversation flow consists of a directed graph of {@link Prompt} objects. Each time a prompt gets input from the user, it must return the next prompt in the graph. Since each Prompt chooses the next Prompt, complex conversation trees can be implemented where the nature of the player's response directs the flow of the conversation.

Each conversation has a {@link ConversationPrefix} that prepends all output from the conversation to the player. The ConversationPrefix can be used to display the plugin name or conversation status as the conversation evolves.

Each conversation has a timeout measured in the number of inactive seconds to wait before abandoning the conversation. If the inactivity timeout is reached, the conversation is abandoned and the user's incoming and outgoing chat is returned to normal.

You should not construct a conversation manually. Instead, use the {@link ConversationFactory} for access to all available options.

methods.name: getDisplayName
methods.comment_text:
Gets the "friendly" name to display of this player. This may include color.

Note that this name will not be displayed in game, only in chat and places defined by plugins.

methods.name: setDisplayName
methods.comment_text:

Note that this name will not be displayed in game, only in chat and places defined by plugins.

methods.name: getPlayerListName
methods.comment_text: Gets the name that is shown on the player list.

methods.name: setPlayerListName
methods.comment_text:
Sets the name that is shown on the in-game player list.

The name cannot be longer than 16 characters, but {@link ChatColor} is supported.

If the value is null, the name will be identical to {@link #getName()}.

This name is case sensitive and unique, two names with different casing will appear as two different people. If a player joins afterwards with a name that conflicts with a player's custom list name, the joining player's player list name will have a random number appended to it (1-2 characters long in the default implementation). If the joining player's name is 15 or 16 characters long, part of the name will be truncated at the end to allow the addition of the two digits.

methods.name: sendChunkChange
methods.comment_text:
Send a chunk change. This fakes a chunk change packet for a user at a certain location. The updated cuboid must be entirely within a single chunk. This will not actually change the world in any way.

At least one of the dimensions of the cuboid must be even. The size of the data buffer must be 2.5*sx*sy*sz and formatted in accordance with the Packet51 format.

If the client does not have a sign at the given location it will display an error message to the user.

parameters.name: lines
