methods.name: setPlayerTime
methods.comment_text:
Sets the current time on the player's client. When relative is true the player's time will be kept synchronized to its world time with the specified offset.

When using non relative time the player's time will stay fixed at the specified time parameter. It's up to the caller to continue updating the player's time. To restore player time to normal use resetPlayerTime().

parameters.name: time
parameters.comment_text:
The current player's perceived time or the player's time
     offset from the server time.

parameters.name: relative
parameters.comment_text:
When true the player time is kept relative to its world
     time.

methods.name: getPlayerTimeOffset

Returns the player's current time offset relative to server time, or

methods.name: isPlayerTimeRelative

Returns true if the player's time is relative to the server time,
 otherwise the player's time is absolute and will not change its current

methods.name: resetPlayerTime
methods.comment_text:
Restores the normal condition where the player's time is synchronized with the server time.

Equivalent to calling setPlayerTime(0, true).

methods.name: setTexturePack
methods.comment_text:
Request that the player's client download and switch texture packs.

The player's client will download the new texture pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached the same texture pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the texture pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server textures on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • There is no concept of resetting texture packs back to default within Minecraft, so players will have to relog to do so or you have to send an empty pack.
  • The request is send with "null" as the hash. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

parameters.name: url
parameters.comment_text:
The URL from which the client will download the texture
     pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
     be encoded as per RFC 1738.

methods.name: setResourcePack
methods.comment_text:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • There is no concept of resetting resource packs back to default within Minecraft, so players will have to relog to do so or you have to send an empty pack.
  • The request is send with "null" as the hash. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

parameters.name: url
parameters.comment_text:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
     pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
     be encoded as per RFC 1738.

methods.name: setResourcePack
methods.comment_text:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached a resource pack with the same hash in the past it will not download but directly apply the cached pack. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • There is no concept of resetting resource packs back to default within Minecraft, so players will have to relog to do so or you have to send an empty pack.

parameters.name: url
parameters.comment_text:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
     pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
     be encoded as per RFC 1738.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.comment_text:
The sha1 hash sum of the resource pack file which is used
     to apply a cached version of the pack directly without downloading
     if it is available. Hast to be 20 bytes long!

methods.name: isHealthScaled
methods.comment_text:
Gets if the client is displayed a 'scaled' health, that is, health on a
 scale from 0-{@link #getHealthScale()}.

methods.name: setHealthScaled
methods.comment_text:
Sets if the client is displayed a 'scaled' health, that is, health on a scale from 0-{@link #getHealthScale()}.

Displayed health follows a simple formula displayedHealth = getHealth() / getMaxHealth() * getHealthScale().

parameters.name: scale
parameters.comment_text: if the client health display is scaled

methods.name: setHealthScale
methods.comment_text:
Sets the number to scale health to for the client; this will also {@link #setHealthScaled(boolean) setHealthScaled(true)}.

Displayed health follows a simple formula displayedHealth = getHealth() / getMaxHealth() * getHealthScale().

parameters.name: scale
parameters.comment_text: the number to scale health to

throws.name: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
throws.comment_text: if scale is <0

methods.name: getHealthScale
methods.comment_text: Gets the number that health is scaled to for the client.

methods.name: sendTitle
methods.comment_text:
Sends a title and a subtitle message to the player. If either of these
 values are null, they will not be sent and the display will remain
 unchanged. If they are empty strings, the display will be updated as
 such. If the strings contain a new line, only the first line will be
 sent. The titles will be displayed with the client's default timings.

methods.name: sendTitle
methods.comment_text:
Sends a title and a subtitle message to the player. If either of these
 values are null, they will not be sent and the display will remain
 unchanged. If they are empty strings, the display will be updated as
 such. If the strings contain a new line, only the first line will be
 sent. All timings values may take a value of -1 to indicate that they
 will use the last value sent (or the defaults if no title has been
 displayed).

parameters.name: fadeIn
parameters.comment_text: time in ticks for titles to fade in. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: stay
parameters.comment_text: time in ticks for titles to stay. Defaults to 70.

parameters.name: fadeOut
parameters.comment_text: time in ticks for titles to fade out. Defaults to 20.

methods.name: resetTitle
methods.comment_text:
Resets the title displayed to the player. This will clear the displayed
 title / subtitle and reset timings to their default values.

methods.comment_text:
Gets the maximum speed of a minecart. The speed is unrelated to the
 velocity.

methods.name: setMaxSpeed

Sets the maximum speed of a minecart. Must be nonnegative. Default is
 0.4D.

 occupying it

methods.name: setSlowWhenEmpty

Sets whether this minecart will slow down faster without a passenger
 occupying it

Gets the flying velocity modifier. Used for minecarts that are in
 mid-air. A flying minecart's velocity is multiplied by this factor each
 tick.

methods.name: setFlyingVelocityMod
methods.comment_text:
Sets the flying velocity modifier. Used for minecarts that are in
 mid-air. A flying minecart's velocity is multiplied by this factor each
 tick.

methods.name: getDerailedVelocityMod
methods.comment_text:
Gets the derailed velocity modifier. Used for minecarts that are on the ground, but not on rails.

A derailed minecart's velocity is multiplied by this factor each tick.

methods.name: setDerailedVelocityMod
methods.comment_text:
Sets the derailed velocity modifier. Used for minecarts that are on the
 ground, but not on rails. A derailed minecart's velocity is multiplied
 by this factor each tick.

 This function will return the type AIR if none is set.

     null for only air)

this is the maximum distance to scan (may be limited
     by server by at least 100 blocks, no less)

This is the maximum duration in which the living entity will not take damage.

parameters.name: ticks

Only damage higher than this amount will further damage the living entity.

methods.name: getNoDamageTicks

Adds the given {@link PotionEffect} to the living entity.

Only one potion effect can be present for a given {@link PotionEffectType}.

Adds the given {@link PotionEffect} to the living entity.

Only one potion effect can be present for a given {@link PotionEffectType}.

parameters.comment_text: whether conflicting effects should be removed

 entity.

 the given {@link PotionEffectType} applied to it.

If the effect is not present on the entity then null will be returned.

 This may have unexpected results if the entity is not in water.

methods.name: setCollidable

Set if this entity will be subject to collisions other entities.

Note that collisions are bidirectional, so this method would need to be set to false on both the collidee and the collidant to ensure no collisions take place.

methods.name: isCollidable
methods.comment_text:
Gets if this entity is subject to collisions with other entities.

Please note that this method returns only the custom collidable state, not whether the entity is non-collidable for other reasons such as being dead.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.IronGolem

methods.name: isPlayerCreated
methods.comment_text: Gets whether this iron golem was built by a player.

methods.name: setPlayerCreated

parameters.comment_text:
true if you want to set the iron golem as being
     player created, false if you want it to be a natural village golem.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Illusioner
classes.comment_text: Represents an Illusioner "Illager".

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Illager
classes.comment_text: Represents a type of "Illager".

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Husk
classes.comment_text: Represents a Husk - variant of {@link Zombie}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity
classes.comment_text: Represents a human entity, such as an NPC or a player

methods.name: getName
methods.comment_text: Returns the name of this player

methods.name: getInventory
methods.comment_text: Get the player's inventory.

methods.name: getEnderChest
methods.comment_text: Get the player's EnderChest inventory

methods.name: getMainHand
methods.comment_text: Gets the player's selected main hand

methods.name: setWindowProperty
methods.comment_text:
If the player currently has an inventory window open, this method will
 set a property of that window, such as the state of a progress bar.

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment_text: The value to set the property to.

methods.name: getOpenInventory
methods.comment_text:
Gets the inventory view the player is currently viewing. If they do not
 have an inventory window open, it returns their internal crafting view.

methods.name: openInventory
methods.comment_text:
Opens an inventory window with the specified inventory on the top and
 the player's inventory on the bottom.

methods.name: openWorkbench
methods.comment_text:
Opens an empty workbench inventory window with the player's inventory
 on the bottom.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text:
The location to attach it to. If null, the player's
     location is used.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text:
If false, and there is no workbench block at the location,
     no inventory will be opened and null will be returned.

methods.name: openEnchanting
methods.comment_text:
Opens an empty enchanting inventory window with the player's inventory
 on the bottom.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text:
The location to attach it to. If null, the player's
     location is used.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text:
If false, and there is no enchanting table at the
     location, no inventory will be opened and null will be returned.

methods.name: openInventory
methods.comment_text: Opens an inventory window to the specified inventory view.

methods.name: openMerchant
methods.comment_text:
Starts a trade between the player and the villager.

 Note that only one player may trade with a villager at once. You must use
 the force parameter for this.

parameters.name: trader
parameters.comment_text: The merchant to trade with. Cannot be null.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text: whether to force the trade even if another player is trading

methods.name: openMerchant
methods.comment_text:
Starts a trade between the player and the merchant.

 Note that only one player may trade with a merchant at once. You must use
 the force parameter for this.

parameters.name: merchant
parameters.comment_text: The merchant to trade with. Cannot be null.

parameters.name: force
parameters.comment_text: whether to force the trade even if another player is trading

methods.name: closeInventory
methods.comment_text: Force-closes the currently open inventory view for this player, if any.

methods.name: getItemInHand
methods.comment_text: Returns the ItemStack currently in your hand, can be empty.

methods.name: setItemInHand
methods.comment_text:
Sets the item to the given ItemStack, this will replace whatever the
 user was holding.

parameters.name: item
parameters.comment_text: The ItemStack which will end up in the hand

methods.name: getItemOnCursor
methods.comment_text:
Returns the ItemStack currently on your cursor, can be empty. Will
 always be empty if the player currently has no open window.

methods.name: setItemOnCursor
methods.comment_text:
Sets the item to the given ItemStack, this will replace whatever the
 user was moving. Will always be empty if the player currently has no
 open window.

parameters.name: item
parameters.comment_text: The ItemStack which will end up in the hand

methods.name: hasCooldown
methods.comment_text: Check whether a cooldown is active on the specified material.

methods.name: getCooldown
methods.comment_text: Get the cooldown time in ticks remaining for the specified material.

methods.name: setCooldown
methods.comment_text:
Set a cooldown on the specified material for a certain amount of ticks. ticks. 0 ticks will result in the removal of the cooldown.

Cooldowns are used by the server for items such as ender pearls and shields to prevent them from being used repeatedly.

Note that cooldowns will not by themselves stop an item from being used for attacking.

parameters.name: material
parameters.comment_text: the material to set the cooldown for

parameters.name: ticks
parameters.comment_text: the amount of ticks to set or 0 to remove

methods.name: isSleeping
methods.comment_text: Returns whether this player is slumbering.

methods.name: getSleepTicks
methods.comment_text: Get the sleep ticks of the player. This value may be capped.

methods.name: getGameMode
methods.comment_text: Gets this human's current {@link GameMode}

methods.name: setGameMode
methods.comment_text: Sets this human's current {@link GameMode}

methods.name: isBlocking
methods.comment_text: Check if the player is currently blocking (ie with a shield).

methods.name: isHandRaised
methods.comment_text:
Check if the player currently has their hand raised (ie about to begin
 blocking).

methods.name: getExpToLevel
methods.comment_text: Get the total amount of experience required for the player to level

methods.name: getShoulderEntityLeft
methods.comment_text:
Gets the entity currently perched on the left shoulder or null if no entity.
The returned entity will not be spawned within the world, so most operations are invalid unless the entity is first spawned in.

methods.name: setShoulderEntityLeft
methods.comment_text:
Sets the entity currently perched on the left shoulder, or null to remove. This method will remove the entity from the world.
Note that only a copy of the entity will be set to display on the shoulder.
Also note that the client will currently only render {@link Parrot} entities.

methods.name: getShoulderEntityRight
methods.comment_text:
Gets the entity currently perched on the right shoulder or null if no entity.
The returned entity will not be spawned within the world, so most operations are invalid unless the entity is first spawned in.

methods.name: setShoulderEntityRight
methods.comment_text:
Sets the entity currently perched on the right shoulder, or null to remove. This method will remove the entity from the world.
Note that only a copy of the entity will be set to display on the shoulder.
Also note that the client will currently only render {@link Parrot} entities.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Horse
classes.comment_text: Represents a Horse.

methods.name: getColor
methods.comment_text:
Gets the horse's color.

Colors only apply to horses, not to donkeys, mules, skeleton horses or undead horses.

methods.name: setColor
methods.comment_text:
Sets the horse's color.

Attempting to set a color for any donkey, mule, skeleton horse or undead horse will not result in a change.

methods.name: getStyle
methods.comment_text:
Gets the horse's style. Styles determine what kind of markings or patterns a horse has.

Styles only apply to horses, not to donkeys, mules, skeleton horses or undead horses.

methods.name: setStyle
methods.comment_text:
Sets the style of this horse. Styles determine what kind of markings or patterns a horse has.

Attempting to set a style for any donkey, mule, skeleton horse or undead horse will not result in a change.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Horse.Color
classes.comment_text: Represents the base color that the horse has.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Horse.Style
classes.comment_text: Represents the style, or markings, that the horse has.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Hanging
classes.comment_text: Represents a Hanging entity

methods.name: setFacingDirection
methods.comment_text:
Sets the direction of the hanging entity, potentially overriding rules
 of placement. Note that if the result is not valid the object would
 normally drop as an item.

methods.name: isElder
methods.comment_text: Check if the Guardian is an elder Guardian

Sets the chance of a fish biting.

0.0 = No Chance.
1.0 = Instant catch.

if the bite chance is not between 0
     and 1

methods.name: getDirection

methods.name: setDropItem
methods.comment_text: Set if the falling block will break into an item if it cannot be placed

methods.name: canHurtEntities
methods.comment_text: Get the HurtEntities state of this block.

parameters.name: hurtEntities
parameters.comment_text: whether entities will be damaged by this block.

methods.name: getYield
methods.comment_text: Return the radius or yield of this explosive's explosion

methods.name: setIsIncendiary

methods.name: isIncendiary
methods.comment_text: Return whether or not this explosive creates a fire when exploding

methods.name: setExperience

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.EvokerFangs

methods.name: getOwner
methods.comment_text: Gets the {@link LivingEntity} which summoned the fangs.

methods.name: setOwner

parameters.name: owner

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Evoker
classes.comment_text: Represents an Evoker "Illager".

methods.name: getCurrentSpell
methods.comment_text: Gets the {@link Spell} the Evoker is currently using.

methods.name: setCurrentSpell
methods.comment_text: Sets the {@link Spell} the Evoker is currently using.

parameters.name: spell
parameters.comment_text: the spell the evoker should be using

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Evoker.Spell
classes.comment_text: Represents the current spell the Evoker is using.

methods.name: isSpawnable
methods.comment_text:
Some entities cannot be spawned using {@link
 World#spawnEntity(Location, EntityType)} or {@link
 World#spawn(Location, Class)}, usually because they require additional
 information in order to spawn.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Entity
classes.comment_text: Represents a base entity in the world

methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment_text: Gets the entity's current position

methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment_text:
Stores the entity's current position in the provided Location object.

If the provided Location is null this method does nothing and returns null.

methods.name: setVelocity
methods.comment_text: Sets this entity's velocity

methods.name: getVelocity
methods.comment_text: Gets this entity's current velocity

methods.name: getHeight
methods.comment_text: Gets the entity's height

methods.name: getWidth
methods.comment_text: Gets the entity's width

methods.name: isOnGround
methods.comment_text:
Returns true if the entity is supported by a block. This value is a
 state updated by the server and is not recalculated unless the entity
 moves.

methods.name: getWorld
methods.comment_text: Gets the current world this entity resides in

methods.name: teleport
methods.comment_text:
Teleports this entity to the given location. If this entity is riding a
 vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: New location to teleport this entity to

methods.name: teleport
methods.comment_text:
Teleports this entity to the given location. If this entity is riding a
 vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: New location to teleport this entity to

methods.name: teleport
methods.comment_text:
Teleports this entity to the target Entity. If this entity is riding a
 vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.comment_text: Entity to teleport this entity to

methods.name: teleport
methods.comment_text:
Teleports this entity to the target Entity. If this entity is riding a
 vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.comment_text: Entity to teleport this entity to

methods.name: getNearbyEntities
methods.comment_text:
Returns a list of entities within a bounding box centered around this
 entity

parameters.name: x
parameters.comment_text: 1/2 the size of the box along x axis

parameters.name: y
parameters.comment_text: 1/2 the size of the box along y axis

parameters.name: z
parameters.comment_text: 1/2 the size of the box along z axis

methods.name: getEntityId
methods.comment_text: Returns a unique id for this entity

methods.name: getFireTicks
methods.comment_text:
Returns the entity's current fire ticks (ticks before the entity stops
 being on fire).

methods.name: getMaxFireTicks
methods.comment_text: Returns the entity's maximum fire ticks.

methods.name: setFireTicks
methods.comment_text:
Sets the entity's current fire ticks (ticks before the entity stops
 being on fire).

methods.name: remove
methods.comment_text: Mark the entity's removal.

methods.name: isDead
methods.comment_text: Returns true if this entity has been marked for removal.

methods.name: isValid
methods.comment_text:
Returns false if the entity has died or been despawned for some other
 reason.

methods.name: getServer
methods.comment_text: Gets the {@link Server} that contains this Entity

methods.name: isPersistent
methods.comment_text:
Returns true if the entity gets persisted.

By default all entities are persistent. An entity will also not get persisted, if it is riding an entity that is not persistent.

The persistent flag has no effect on players. If a player is directly or indirectly riding a non-persistent entity, the vehicle at the root and all its passengers won't get persisted.

This should not be confused with {@link LivingEntity#setRemoveWhenFarAway(boolean)} which controls despawning of living entities.

methods.name: setPersistent
methods.comment_text: Sets whether or not the entity gets persisted.

methods.name: getPassenger
methods.comment_text:
Gets the primary passenger of a vehicle. For vehicles that could have
 multiple passengers, this will only return the primary passenger.

methods.name: setPassenger
methods.comment_text: Set the passenger of a vehicle.

methods.name: getPassengers
methods.comment_text:
Gets a list of passengers of this vehicle.

The returned list will not be directly linked to the entity's current passengers, and no guarantees are made as to its mutability.

methods.name: addPassenger
methods.comment_text: Add a passenger to the vehicle.

methods.name: removePassenger
methods.comment_text: Remove a passenger from the vehicle.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.comment_text: Check if a vehicle has passengers.

methods.name: eject
methods.comment_text: Eject any passenger.

methods.name: getFallDistance
methods.comment_text: Returns the distance this entity has fallen

methods.name: setFallDistance
methods.comment_text: Sets the fall distance for this entity

methods.name: setLastDamageCause
methods.comment_text: Record the last {@link EntityDamageEvent} inflicted on this entity

methods.name: getLastDamageCause
methods.comment_text:
Retrieve the last {@link EntityDamageEvent} inflicted on this entity.
 This event may have been cancelled.

methods.name: getUniqueId
methods.comment_text: Returns a unique and persistent id for this entity

methods.name: getTicksLived
methods.comment_text:
Gets the amount of ticks this entity has lived for.

This is the equivalent to "age" in entities.

methods.name: setTicksLived
methods.comment_text:
Sets the amount of ticks this entity has lived for.

This is the equivalent to "age" in entities. May not be less than one tick.

methods.name: playEffect
methods.comment_text:
Performs the specified {@link EntityEffect} for this entity.

This will be viewable to all players near the entity.

If the effect is not applicable to this class of entity, it will not play.

methods.name: getType
methods.comment_text: Get the type of the entity.

methods.name: isInsideVehicle
methods.comment_text: Returns whether this entity is inside a vehicle.

methods.name: leaveVehicle
methods.comment_text:
Leave the current vehicle. If the entity is currently in a vehicle (and
 is removed from it), true will be returned, otherwise false will be
 returned.

methods.name: getVehicle
methods.comment_text:
Get the vehicle that this player is inside. If there is no vehicle,
 null will be returned.

methods.name: setCustomNameVisible
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether or not to display the mob's custom name client side. The name will be displayed above the mob similarly to a player.

This value has no effect on players, they will always display their name.

methods.name: isCustomNameVisible
methods.comment_text:
Gets whether or not the mob's custom name is displayed client side.

This value has no effect on players, they will always display their name.

methods.name: setGlowing
methods.comment_text: Sets whether the entity has a team colored (default: white) glow.

methods.name: isGlowing
methods.comment_text: Gets whether the entity is glowing or not.

methods.name: setInvulnerable
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether the entity is invulnerable or not.

When an entity is invulnerable it can only be damaged by players in creative mode.

methods.name: isInvulnerable
methods.comment_text: Gets whether the entity is invulnerable or not.

methods.name: isSilent
methods.comment_text: Gets whether the entity is silent or not.

methods.name: setSilent
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether the entity is silent or not.

When an entity is silent it will not produce any sound.

methods.name: hasGravity
methods.comment_text: Returns whether gravity applies to this entity.

methods.name: setGravity
methods.comment_text: Sets whether gravity applies to this entity.

methods.name: getPortalCooldown
methods.comment_text: Gets the period of time (in ticks) before this entity can use a portal.

methods.name: setPortalCooldown
methods.comment_text: Sets the period of time (in ticks) before this entity can use a portal.

methods.name: getScoreboardTags
methods.comment_text:
Returns a set of tags for this entity.
Entities can have no more than 1024 tags.

methods.name: addScoreboardTag
methods.comment_text:
Add a tag to this entity.
Entities can have no more than 1024 tags.

methods.name: removeScoreboardTag
methods.comment_text: Removes a given tag from this entity.

methods.name: getPistonMoveReaction
methods.comment_text: Returns the reaction of the entity when moved by a piston.

methods.name: getFacing
methods.comment_text:
Get the closest cardinal {@link BlockFace} direction an entity is currently facing.
This will not return any non-cardinal directions such as {@link BlockFace#UP} or {@link BlockFace#DOWN}.
{@link Hanging} entities will override this call and thus their behavior may be different.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.EnderSignal
classes.comment_text: Represents an EnderSignal, which is created upon throwing an ender eye.

methods.name: getTargetLocation
methods.comment_text: Get the location this EnderSignal is moving towards.

methods.name: setTargetLocation
methods.comment_text:
Set the {@link Location} this EnderSignal is moving towards.
When setting a new target location, the {@link #getDropItem()} resets to a random value and the despawn timer gets set back to 0.

methods.name: getDropItem
methods.comment_text:
Gets if the EnderSignal should drop an item on death.
If {@code true}, it will drop an item. If {@code false}, it will shatter.

methods.name: setDropItem
methods.comment_text:
Sets if the EnderSignal should drop an item on death; or if it should
 shatter.

parameters.name: drop
parameters.comment_text:
true if the EnderSignal should drop an item on death, or
 false if it should shatter.

methods.name: getDespawnTimer
methods.comment_text:
Gets the amount of time this entity has been alive (in ticks).
When this number is greater than 80, it will despawn on the next tick.

methods.name: setDespawnTimer
methods.comment_text:
Set how long this entity has been alive (in ticks).
When this number is greater than 80, it will despawn on the next tick.

parameters.name: timer
parameters.comment_text: how long (in ticks) this EnderSignal has been alive.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.EnderPearl
classes.comment_text: Represents a thrown Ender Pearl entity

methods.name: setCarriedMaterial
methods.comment_text: Sets the id and data of the block that the Enderman is carrying.

parameters.name: material
parameters.comment_text: data to set the carried block to

methods.name: getCarriedBlock
methods.comment_text: Gets the data of the block that the Enderman is carrying.

methods.name: setCarriedBlock
methods.comment_text: Sets the data of the block that the Enderman is carrying.

parameters.name: blockData
parameters.comment_text: data to set the carried block to, or null to remove

methods.name: setPhase

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.EnderDragon.Phase

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.EnderCrystal
classes.comment_text: A crystal that heals nearby EnderDragons

methods.name: isShowingBottom
methods.comment_text:
Return whether or not this end crystal is showing the
 bedrock slate underneath it.

methods.name: setShowingBottom
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether or not this end crystal is showing the
 bedrock slate underneath it.

parameters.name: showing
parameters.comment_text: whether the bedrock slate should be shown

methods.name: getBeamTarget
methods.comment_text: Gets the location that this end crystal is pointing its beam to.

methods.name: setBeamTarget
methods.comment_text:
Sets the location that this end crystal is pointing to. Passing a null
 value will remove the current beam.

parameters.name: location
parameters.comment_text: the location to point the beam to

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.ElderGuardian
classes.comment_text: Represents an ElderGuardian - variant of {@link Guardian}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Egg
classes.comment_text: Represents a thrown egg.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Drowned
classes.comment_text: Drowned zombie.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Donkey
classes.comment_text: Represents a Donkey - variant of {@link ChestedHorse}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.Damageable
classes.comment_text: Represents an {@link Entity} that has health and can take damage.

methods.name: damage
methods.comment_text: Deals the given amount of damage to this entity.

methods.name: damage
methods.comment_text:
Deals the given amount of damage to this entity, from a specified
 entity.

parameters.name: source
parameters.comment_text: Entity which to attribute this damage from

methods.name: getHealth
methods.comment_text: Gets the entity's health from 0 to {@link #getMaxHealth()}, where 0 is dead.

methods.name: setHealth
methods.comment_text:
Sets the entity's health from 0 to {@link #getMaxHealth()}, where 0 is
 dead.

parameters.name: health
parameters.comment_text: New health represented from 0 to max

methods.name: getMaxHealth
methods.comment_text: Gets the maximum health this entity has.

methods.name: setMaxHealth
methods.comment_text:
Sets the maximum health this entity can have.

If the health of the entity is above the value provided it will be set to that value.

Note: An entity with a health bar ({@link Player}, {@link EnderDragon}, {@link Wither}, etc...} will have their bar scaled accordingly.

parameters.name: health
parameters.comment_text: amount of health to set the maximum to

methods.name: resetMaxHealth
methods.comment_text: Resets the max health to the original amount.

classes.comment_text: Represents a boat entity.

methods.name: getWoodType
methods.comment_text: Gets the wood type of the boat.

methods.name: setWoodType
methods.comment_text: Sets the wood type of the boat.

methods.name: getMaxSpeed
methods.comment_text:
Gets the maximum speed of a boat. The speed is unrelated to the
 velocity.

methods.name: setMaxSpeed
methods.comment_text: Sets the maximum speed of a boat. Must be nonnegative. Default is 0.4D.

methods.name: getOccupiedDeceleration
methods.comment_text:
Gets the deceleration rate (newSpeed = curSpeed * rate) of occupied
 boats. The default is 0.2.

methods.name: setOccupiedDeceleration
methods.comment_text:
Sets the deceleration rate (newSpeed = curSpeed * rate) of occupied
 boats. Setting this to a higher value allows for quicker acceleration.
 The default is 0.2.

methods.name: getUnoccupiedDeceleration
methods.comment_text:
Gets the deceleration rate (newSpeed = curSpeed * rate) of unoccupied
 boats. The default is -1. Values below 0 indicate that no additional
 deceleration is imposed.

methods.name: setUnoccupiedDeceleration
methods.comment_text:
Sets the deceleration rate (newSpeed = curSpeed * rate) of unoccupied
 boats. Setting this to a higher value allows for quicker deceleration
 of boats when a player disembarks. The default is -1. Values below 0
 indicate that no additional deceleration is imposed.

methods.name: getWorkOnLand
methods.comment_text: Get whether boats can work on land.

methods.name: setWorkOnLand
methods.comment_text: Set whether boats can work on land.

parameters.name: workOnLand
parameters.comment_text: whether boats can work on land

methods.comment_text:
Checks the current waking state of this bat.

This does not imply any persistence of state past the method call.

methods.name: setAwake
methods.comment_text:
This method modifies the current waking state of this bat.

This does not prevent a bat from spontaneously awaking itself, or from reattaching itself to a block.

Arrows in a block are motionless and may be picked up by players.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.AreaEffectCloud
classes.comment_text:
Represents an area effect cloud which will imbue a potion effect onto
 entities which enter it.

methods.name: getDuration
methods.comment_text: Gets the duration which this cloud will exist for (in ticks).

methods.name: setDuration
methods.comment_text: Sets the duration which this cloud will exist for (in ticks).

methods.name: getWaitTime
methods.comment_text:
Gets the time which an entity has to be exposed to the cloud before the
 effect is applied.

methods.name: setWaitTime
methods.comment_text:
Sets the time which an entity has to be exposed to the cloud before the
 effect is applied.

methods.name: getReapplicationDelay
methods.comment_text: Gets the time that an entity will be immune from subsequent exposure.

methods.name: setReapplicationDelay
methods.comment_text: Sets the time that an entity will be immune from subsequent exposure.

methods.name: getDurationOnUse
methods.comment_text:
Gets the amount that the duration of this cloud will decrease by when it
 applies an effect to an entity.

methods.name: setDurationOnUse
methods.comment_text:
Sets the amount that the duration of this cloud will decrease by when it
 applies an effect to an entity.

methods.name: getRadius
methods.comment_text: Gets the initial radius of the cloud.

methods.name: setRadius
methods.comment_text: Sets the initial radius of the cloud.

methods.name: getRadiusOnUse
methods.comment_text:
Gets the amount that the radius of this cloud will decrease by when it
 applies an effect to an entity.

methods.name: setRadiusOnUse
methods.comment_text:
Sets the amount that the radius of this cloud will decrease by when it
 applies an effect to an entity.

methods.name: getRadiusPerTick
methods.comment_text: Gets the amount that the radius of this cloud will decrease by each tick.

methods.name: setRadiusPerTick
methods.comment_text: Gets the amount that the radius of this cloud will decrease by each tick.

methods.name: getParticle
methods.comment_text: Gets the particle which this cloud will be composed of

methods.name: setParticle

methods.name: setParticle
methods.comment_text: Sets the particle which this cloud will be composed of

parameters.name: data
parameters.comment_text:
the data to use for the particle or null,
             the type of this depends on {@link Particle#getDataType()}

methods.comment_text: Sets the underlying potion data

parameters.name: data
parameters.comment_text: PotionData to set the base potion state to

methods.name: getBasePotionData
methods.comment_text: Returns the potion data about the base potion

methods.name: hasCustomEffects
methods.comment_text: Checks for the presence of custom potion effects.

methods.name: getCustomEffects

Gets an immutable list containing all custom potion effects applied to this cloud.

Plugins should check that hasCustomEffects() returns true before calling this method.

true if any existing effect of the same type should be

methods.name: clearCustomEffects

methods.name: setColor

methods.comment_text: Retrieve the original source of this cloud.

Lock the age of the animal, setting this will prevent the animal from

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.AbstractHorse
classes.comment_text: Represents a Horse-like creature.

methods.name: getVariant
methods.comment_text:
Gets the horse's variant.

A horse's variant defines its physical appearance and capabilities. Whether a horse is a regular horse, donkey, mule, or other kind of horse is determined using the variant.

methods.name: getDomestication
methods.comment_text:
Gets the domestication level of this horse.

A higher domestication level indicates that the horse is closer to becoming tame. As the domestication level gets closer to the max domestication level, the chance of the horse becoming tame increases.

methods.name: setDomestication
methods.comment_text:
Sets the domestication level of this horse.

Setting the domestication level to a high value will increase the horse's chances of becoming tame.

Domestication level must be greater than zero and no greater than the max domestication level of the horse, determined with {@link #getMaxDomestication()}

methods.name: getMaxDomestication
methods.comment_text:
Gets the maximum domestication level of this horse.

The higher this level is, the longer it will likely take for the horse to be tamed.

methods.name: setMaxDomestication
methods.comment_text:
Sets the maximum domestication level of this horse.

Setting a higher max domestication will increase the amount of domesticating (feeding, riding, etc.) necessary in order to tame it, while setting a lower max value will have the opposite effect.

Maximum domestication must be greater than zero.

methods.name: getJumpStrength
methods.comment_text:
Gets the jump strength of this horse.

Jump strength defines how high the horse can jump. A higher jump strength increases how high a jump will go.

methods.name: setJumpStrength
methods.comment_text:
Sets the jump strength of this horse.

A higher jump strength increases how high a jump will go. Setting a jump strength to 0 will result in no jump. You cannot set a jump strength to a value below 0 or above 2.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.StorageMinecart
classes.comment_text:
Represents a minecart with a chest. These types of {@link Minecart
 minecarts} have their own inventory that can be accessed using methods
 from the {@link InventoryHolder} interface.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.SpawnerMinecart
classes.comment_text:
Represents a Minecart with an {@link org.bukkit.block.CreatureSpawner
 entity spawner} inside it.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.RideableMinecart
classes.comment_text:
Represents a minecart that can have certain {@link
 org.bukkit.entity.Entity entities} as passengers. Normal passengers
 include all {@link org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity living entities} with
 the exception of {@link org.bukkit.entity.IronGolem iron golems}.
 Non-player entities that meet normal passenger criteria automatically
 mount these minecarts when close enough.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.PoweredMinecart
classes.comment_text:
Represents a powered minecart. A powered minecart moves on its own when a
 player deposits {@link org.bukkit.Material#COAL fuel}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.HopperMinecart

methods.comment_text:
Checks whether or not this Minecart will pick up 
 items into its inventory.

methods.name: setEnabled
methods.comment_text: Sets whether this Minecart will pick up items.

classes.name: org.bukkit.entity.minecart.ExplosiveMinecart
classes.comment_text: Represents a Minecart with TNT inside it that can explode when triggered.

methods.name: getCommand
methods.comment_text:
Gets the command that this CommandMinecart will run when activated.
 This will never return null.  If the CommandMinecart does not have a
 command, an empty String will be returned instead.

methods.name: setCommand
methods.comment_text:
Sets the command that this CommandMinecart will run when activated.
 Setting the command to null is the same as setting it to an empty

parameters.name: command
parameters.comment_text:
Command that this CommandMinecart will run when
     activated.

methods.name: setName
methods.comment_text:
Sets the name of this CommandMinecart.  The name is used with commands
 that this CommandMinecart executes.  Setting the name to null is the
 same as setting it to "@".

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.SpongeAbsorbEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a sponge absorbs water from the world.
The world will be in its previous state, and {@link #getBlocks()} will represent the changes to be made to the world, if the event is not cancelled.
As this is a physics based event it may be called multiple times for "the same" changes.

methods.name: getBlocks
methods.comment_text:
Get a list of all blocks to be removed by the sponge.
This list is mutable and contains the blocks in their removed state, i.e. having a type of {@link Material#AIR}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.SignChangeEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a sign is changed by a player.

If a Sign Change event is cancelled, the sign will not be changed.

methods.name: getPlayer
methods.comment_text: Gets the player changing the sign involved in this event.

methods.name: getLines
methods.comment_text: Gets all of the lines of text from the sign involved in this event.

methods.name: getLine
methods.comment_text: Gets a single line of text from the sign involved in this event.

parameters.name: index

throws.name: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
throws.comment_text:
thrown when the provided index is {@literal > 3
     or < 0}

methods.comment_text: Sets a single line for the sign involved in this event

parameters.name: index
parameters.comment_text: index of the line to set

throws.name: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
throws.comment_text:
thrown when the provided index is {@literal > 3
     or < 0}

Called when a block is formed by entities.

Examples:

  • Snow formed by a {@link org.bukkit.entity.Snowman}.
  • Frosted Ice formed by the Frost Walker enchantment.

Use {@link BlockFormEvent} to catch blocks that "randomly" form instead of actually spread.

Examples:

  • Mushrooms spreading.
  • Fire spreading.

If a Block Spread event is cancelled, the block will not spread.

classes.comment_text: Called when a redstone current changes

methods.name: getNewCurrent

methods.name: setNewCurrent

If a Block Place event is cancelled, the block will not be placed.

methods.comment_text: Gets the player who placed the block involved in this event.

methods.name: getBlockPlaced

Clarity method for getting the placed block. Not really needed except

methods.name: getBlockAgainst

Gets the value whether the player would be allowed to build here.
 Defaults to spawn if the server was going to stop them (such as, the
 player is in Spawn). Note that this is an entirely different check

 rule like cactus on dirt.

methods.name: setBuild
methods.comment_text:
Sets the canBuild state of this event. Set to true if you want the
 player to be able to build.

parameters.name: canBuild
parameters.comment_text: true if you want the player to be able to build

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPistonRetractEvent
classes.comment_text: Called when a piston retracts

Gets the location where the possible moving block might be if the
 retracting piston is sticky.

methods.name: getBlocks

Get an immutable list of the blocks which will be moved by the

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPistonExtendEvent
classes.comment_text: Called when a piston extends

methods.name: getLength
methods.comment_text: Get the amount of blocks which will be moved while extending.

methods.name: getBlocks

Get an immutable list of the blocks which will be moved by the

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPistonEvent
classes.comment_text: Called when a piston block is triggered

methods.name: isSticky
methods.comment_text: Returns true if the Piston in the event is sticky.

methods.name: getDirection
methods.comment_text: Return the direction in which the piston will operate.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPhysicsEvent
classes.comment_text:
Thrown when a block physics check is called.
This event is a high frequency event, it may be called thousands of times per a second on a busy server. Plugins are advised to listen to the event with caution and only perform lightweight checks when using it.
In addition to this, cancelling the event is liable to leave the world in an inconsistent state. For example if you use the event to leave a block floating in mid air when that block has a requirement to be attached to something, there is no guarantee that the floating block will persist across server restarts or map upgrades.
Plugins should also note that where possible this event may only called for the "root" block of physics updates in order to limit event spam. Physics updates that cause other blocks to change their state may not result in an event for each of those blocks (usually adjacent). If you are concerned about monitoring these changes then you should check adjacent blocks yourself.

methods.name: getChangedType
methods.comment_text: Gets the type of block that changed, causing this event

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockMultiPlaceEvent
classes.comment_text:
Fired when a single block placement action of a player triggers the
 creation of multiple blocks(e.g. placing a bed block). The block returned
 by {@link #getBlockPlaced()} and its related methods is the block where
 the placed block would exist if the placement only affected a single
 block.

methods.name: getReplacedBlockStates
methods.comment_text:
Gets a list of blockstates for all blocks which were replaced by the

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockGrowEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a block grows naturally in the world.

Examples:

  • Wheat
  • Sugar Cane
  • Cactus
  • Watermelon
  • Pumpkin

If a Block Grow event is cancelled, the block will not grow.

methods.name: getNewState
methods.comment_text: Gets the state of the block where it will form or spread to.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFromToEvent
classes.comment_text:
Represents events with a source block and a destination block, currently only applies to liquid (lava and water) and teleporting dragon eggs.

If a Block From To event is cancelled, the block will not move (the liquid will not flow).

methods.name: getToBlock

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFormEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a block is formed or spreads based on world conditions.

Use {@link BlockSpreadEvent} to catch blocks that actually spread and don't just "randomly" form.

Examples:

  • Snow forming due to a snow storm.
  • Ice forming in a snowy Biome like Taiga or Tundra.
  • Obsidian / Cobblestone forming due to contact with water.
  • Concrete forming due to mixing of concrete powder and water.

If a Block Form event is cancelled, the block will not be formed.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFertilizeEvent

methods.name: getBlocks

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFadeEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a block fades, melts or disappears based on world conditions

Examples:

  • Snow melting due to being near a light source.
  • Ice melting due to being near a light source.
  • Fire burning out after time, without destroying fuel block.
  • Coral fading to dead coral due to lack of water

If a Block Fade event is cancelled, the block will not fade, melt or disappear.

methods.name: getNewState
methods.comment_text:
Gets the state of the block that will be fading, melting or

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockCanBuildEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when we try to place a block, to see if we can build it here or not.

Note:

  • The Block returned by getBlock() is the block we are trying to place on, not the block we are trying to place.
  • If you want to figure out what is being placed, use {@link #getMaterial()} instead.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment_text: the id of the block to place

Gets whether or not the block can be built here.

By default, returns Minecraft's answer on whether the block can be built here or not.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBreakEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when a block is broken by a player.

If you wish to have the block drop experience, you must set the experience value above 0. By default, experience will be set in the event if:

  1. The player is not in creative or adventure mode
  2. The player can loot the block (ie: does not destroy it completely, by using the correct tool)
  3. The player does not have silk touch
  4. The block drops experience in vanilla Minecraft

Note: Plugins wanting to simulate a traditional block drop should set the block to air and utilize their own methods for determining what the default drop for the block being broken is and what to do about it, if anything.

If a Block Break event is cancelled, the block will not break and experience will not drop.

methods.name: getPlayer
methods.comment_text: Gets the Player that is breaking the block involved in this event.

methods.name: setDropItems
methods.comment_text: Sets whether or not the block will drop items as it normally would.

parameters.name: dropItems
parameters.comment_text: Whether or not the block will drop items

methods.name: isDropItems
methods.comment_text: Gets whether or not the block will drop items.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.Event
classes.comment_text:
Represents an event.

 All events require a static method named getHandlerList() which returns the same {@link HandlerList} as {@link #getHandlers()}.

constructors.name: Event
constructors.comment_text:
The default constructor is defined for cleaner code. This constructor
 assumes the event is synchronous.

constructors.name: Event
constructors.comment_text:
This constructor is used to explicitly declare an event as synchronous
 or asynchronous.

parameters.name: isAsync
parameters.comment_text:
true indicates the event will fire asynchronously, false
     by default from default constructor

methods.name: getEventName
methods.comment_text:
Convenience method for providing a user-friendly identifier. By
 default, it is the event's class's {@linkplain Class#getSimpleName()
 simple name}.

methods.name: isAsynchronous
methods.comment_text:
Any custom event that should not by synchronized with other events must use the specific constructor. These are the caveats of using an asynchronous event:
  • The event is never fired from inside code triggered by a synchronous event. Attempting to do so results in an {@link java.lang.IllegalStateException}.
  • However, asynchronous event handlers may fire synchronous or asynchronous events
  • The event may be fired multiple times simultaneously and in any order.
  • Any newly registered or unregistered handler is ignored after an event starts execution.
  • The handlers for this event may block for any length of time.
  • Some implementations may selectively declare a specific event use as asynchronous. This behavior should be clearly defined.
  • Asynchronous calls are not calculated in the plugin timing system.

methods.name: isCancelled
methods.comment_text:
Gets the cancellation state of this event. A cancelled event will not
 be executed in the server, but will still pass to other plugins

methods.name: setCancelled
methods.comment_text:
Sets the cancellation state of this event. A cancelled event will not
 be executed in the server, but will still pass to other plugins.

parameters.name: cancel
parameters.comment_text: true if you wish to cancel this event

methods.name: getLocation

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.entity.HorseJumpEvent
classes.comment_text: Called when a horse jumps.

methods.name: getPower
methods.comment_text:
Gets the power of the jump.

Power is a value that defines how much of the horse's jump strength should be used for the jump. Power is effectively multiplied times the horse's jump strength to determine how high the jump is; 0 represents no jump strength while 1 represents full jump strength. Setting power to a value above 1 will use additional jump strength that the horse does not usually have.

Power does not affect how high the horse is capable of jumping, only how much of its jumping capability will be used in this jump. To set the horse's overall jump strength, see {@link AbstractHorse#setJumpStrength(double)}.

methods.name: setPower
methods.comment_text:
Sets the power of the jump.

Jump power can be set to a value above 1.0 which will increase the strength of this jump above the horse's actual jump strength.

Setting the jump power to 0 will result in the jump animation still playing, but the horse not leaving the ground. Only canceling this event will result in no jump animation at all.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryMoveItemEvent
classes.comment_text:
Called when some entity or block (e.g. hopper) tries to move items directly from one inventory to another.

When this event is called, the initiator may already have removed the item from the source inventory and is ready to move it into the destination inventory.

If this event is cancelled, the items will be returned to the source inventory, if needed.

If this event is not cancelled, the initiator will try to put the ItemStack into the destination inventory. If this is not possible and the ItemStack has not been modified, the source inventory slot will be restored to its former state. Otherwise any additional items will be discarded.

methods.name: getSource
methods.comment_text: Gets the Inventory that the ItemStack is being taken from

methods.name: getItem
methods.comment_text:
Gets the ItemStack being moved; if modified, the original item will not
 be removed from the source inventory.

methods.name: setItem
methods.comment_text:
Sets the ItemStack being moved; if this is different from the original
 ItemStack, the original item will not be removed from the source
 inventory.

methods.name: getDestination
methods.comment_text: Gets the Inventory that the ItemStack is being put into

methods.name: getInitiator
methods.comment_text:
Gets the Inventory that initiated the transfer. This will always be
 either the destination or source Inventory.

{@inheritDoc}

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryDragEvent
classes.comment_text:
This event is called when the player drags an item in their cursor across the inventory. The ItemStack is distributed across the slots the HumanEntity dragged over. The method of distribution is described by the DragType returned by {@link #getType()}.

Canceling this event will result in none of the changes described in {@link #getNewItems()} being applied to the Inventory.

Because InventoryDragEvent occurs within a modification of the Inventory, not all Inventory related methods are safe to use.

The following should never be invoked by an EventHandler for InventoryDragEvent using the HumanEntity or InventoryView associated with this event.

  • {@link HumanEntity#closeInventory()}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openInventory(Inventory)}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openWorkbench(Location, boolean)}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openEnchanting(Location, boolean)}
  • {@link InventoryView#close()}
To invoke one of these methods, schedule a task using {@link BukkitScheduler#runTask(Plugin, Runnable)}, which will run the task on the next tick. Also be aware that this is not an exhaustive list, and other methods could potentially create issues as well.

Assuming the EntityHuman associated with this event is an instance of a Player, manipulating the MaxStackSize or contents of an Inventory will require an Invocation of {@link Player#updateInventory()}.

Any modifications to slots that are modified by the results of this InventoryDragEvent will be overwritten. To change these slots, this event should be cancelled and the changes applied. Alternatively, scheduling a task using {@link BukkitScheduler#runTask(Plugin, Runnable)}, which would execute the task on the next tick, would work as well.

methods.name: getNewItems
methods.comment_text: Gets all items to be added to the inventory in this drag.

methods.name: getRawSlots
methods.comment_text: Gets the raw slot ids to be changed in this drag.

methods.name: getInventorySlots
methods.comment_text: Gets the slots to be changed in this drag.

methods.name: getCursor
methods.comment_text:
Gets the result cursor after the drag is done. The returned value is
 mutable.

methods.name: setCursor
methods.comment_text:
Sets the result cursor after the drag is done.

Changing this item stack changes the cursor item. Note that changing the affected "dragged" slots does not change this ItemStack, nor does changing this ItemStack affect the "dragged" slots.

methods.name: getOldCursor
methods.comment_text:
Gets an ItemStack representing the cursor prior to any modifications
 as a result of this drag.

methods.name: getType
methods.comment_text:
Gets the DragType that describes the behavior of ItemStacks placed after this InventoryDragEvent.

The ItemStacks and the raw slots that they're being applied to can be found using {@link #getNewItems()}.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent
classes.comment_text:
This event is called when a player clicks a slot in an inventory.

Because InventoryClickEvent occurs within a modification of the Inventory, not all Inventory related methods are safe to use.

The following should never be invoked by an EventHandler for InventoryClickEvent using the HumanEntity or InventoryView associated with this event:

  • {@link HumanEntity#closeInventory()}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openInventory(Inventory)}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openWorkbench(Location, boolean)}
  • {@link HumanEntity#openEnchanting(Location, boolean)}
  • {@link InventoryView#close()}
To invoke one of these methods, schedule a task using {@link BukkitScheduler#runTask(Plugin, Runnable)}, which will run the task on the next tick. Also be aware that this is not an exhaustive list, and other methods could potentially create issues as well.

Assuming the EntityHuman associated with this event is an instance of a Player, manipulating the MaxStackSize or contents of an Inventory will require an Invocation of {@link Player#updateInventory()}.

Modifications to slots that are modified by the results of this InventoryClickEvent can be overwritten. To change these slots, this event should be cancelled and all desired changes to the inventory applied. Alternatively, scheduling a task using {@link BukkitScheduler#runTask( Plugin, Runnable)}, which would execute the task on the next tick, would work as well.

methods.name: getSlotType
methods.comment_text: Gets the type of slot that was clicked.

methods.name: getCursor
methods.comment_text: Gets the current ItemStack on the cursor.

methods.name: getCurrentItem
methods.comment_text: Gets the ItemStack currently in the clicked slot.

Gets whether or not the ClickType for this event represents a right

methods.name: isLeftClick

Gets whether or not the ClickType for this event represents a left

methods.name: isShiftClick

Gets whether the ClickType for this event indicates that the key was

methods.comment_text: Sets the ItemStack currently in the clicked slot.

The slot number that was clicked, ready for passing to

methods.comment_text:
The raw slot number clicked, ready for passing to {@link InventoryView

This action cannot be changed, and represents what the normal outcome of the event will be. To change the behavior of this InventoryClickEvent, changes must be manually applied.

Gets the ClickType for this event.

This is insulated against changes to the inventory by other plugins.

For other entities see {@link org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityPortalEvent}

methods.name: useTravelAgent
methods.comment_text:
Sets whether or not the Travel Agent will be used.

If this is set to true, the TravelAgent will try to find a Portal at the {@link #getTo()} Location, and will try to create one if there is none.

If this is set to false, the {@link #getPlayer()} will only be teleported to the {@link #getTo()} Location.

parameters.name: useTravelAgent
parameters.comment_text: whether to use the Travel Agent

methods.name: useTravelAgent
methods.comment_text:
Gets whether or not the Travel Agent will be used.

If this is set to true, the TravelAgent will try to find a Portal at the {@link #getTo()} Location, and will try to create one if there is none.

If this is set to false, the {@link #getPlayer()}} will only be teleported to the {@link #getTo()} Location.

classes.comment_text:
This event will fire when a player is finishing consuming an item (food, potion, milk bucket).
If the ItemStack is modified the server will use the effects of the new item and not remove the original one from the player's inventory.
If the event is cancelled the effect will not be applied and the item will not be removed from the player's inventory.

classes.comment_text:
Represents an event that is called when a player interacts with an object or air, potentially fired once for each hand. The hand can be determined using {@link #getHand()}.

This event will fire as cancelled if the vanilla behavior is to do nothing (e.g interacting with air)

methods.name: getAction
methods.comment_text: Returns the action type

methods.name: isCancelled
methods.comment_text:
Gets the cancellation state of this event. Set to true if you want to
 prevent buckets from placing water and so forth

methods.name: setCancelled
methods.comment_text:
Sets the cancellation state of this event. A canceled event will not be executed in the server, but will still pass to other plugins

Canceling this event will prevent use of food (player won't lose the food item), prevent bows/snowballs/eggs from firing, etc. (player won't lose the ammo)

parameters.name: cancel
parameters.comment_text: true if you wish to cancel this event

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerCommandSendEvent
classes.comment_text:
This event is called when the list of available server commands is sent to the player.
Commands may be removed from display using this event, but implementations are not required to securely remove all traces of the command. If secure removal of commands is required, then the command should be assigned a permission which is not granted to the player.

methods.name: getCommands
methods.comment_text:
Returns a mutable collection of all top level commands to be sent.
It is not legal to add entries to this collection, only remove them. Behaviour of adding entries is undefined.

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerCommandPreprocessEvent
classes.comment_text:
This event is called whenever a player runs a command (by placing a slash at the start of their message). It is called early in the command handling process, and modifications in this event (via {@link #setMessage(String)}) will be shown in the behavior.

Many plugins will have no use for this event, and you should attempt to avoid using it if it is not necessary.

Some examples of valid uses for this event are:

  • Logging executed commands to a separate file
  • Variable substitution. For example, replacing ${nearbyPlayer} with the name of the nearest other player, or simulating the @a and @p decorators used by Command Blocks in plugins that do not handle it.
  • Conditionally blocking commands belonging to other plugins. For example, blocking the use of the /home command in a combat arena.
  • Per-sender command aliases. For example, after a player runs the command /calias cr gamemode creative, the next time they run /cr, it gets replaced into /gamemode creative. (Global command aliases should be done by registering the alias.)

Examples of incorrect uses are:

  • Using this event to run command logic

If the event is cancelled, processing of the command will halt.

The state of whether or not there is a slash (/) at the beginning of the message should be preserved. If a slash is added or removed, unexpected behavior may result.

classes.comment_text: Called when a player interacts with an armor stand and will either swap, retrieve or place an item.

methods.name: getPlayerItem
methods.comment_text:
Returns the item held by the player. If this Item is null and the armor stand Item is also null,
 there will be no transaction between the player and the armor stand.
 If the Player's item is null, but the armor stand item is not then the player will obtain the armor stand item.
 In the case that the Player's item is not null, but the armor stand item is null, the players item will be placed on the armor stand.
 If both items are not null, the items will be swapped.
 In the case that the event is cancelled the original items will remain the same.

methods.name: getArmorStandItem
methods.comment_text:
Returns the item held by the armor stand.
 If this Item is null and the player's Item is also null, there will be no transaction between the player and the armor stand.
 If the Player's item is null, but the armor stand item is not then the player will obtain the armor stand item.
 In the case that the Player's item is not null, but the armor stand item is null, the players item will be placed on the armor stand.
 If both items are not null, the items will be swapped.
 In the case that the event is cancelled the original items will remain the same.

classes.comment_text:
This event will sometimes fire synchronously, depending on how it was triggered.

The constructor provides a boolean to indicate if the event was fired synchronously or asynchronously. When asynchronous, this event can be called from any thread, sans the main thread, and has limited access to the API.

If a player is the direct cause of this event by an incoming packet, this event will be asynchronous. If a plugin triggers this event by compelling a player to chat, this event will be synchronous.

Care should be taken to check {@link #isAsynchronous()} and treat the event appropriately.

classes.comment_text: Miscellaneous server events

classes.name: org.bukkit.event.server.ServerCommandEvent
classes.comment_text:
This event is called when a command is run by a non-player. It is called early in the command handling process, and modifications in this event (via {@link #setCommand(String)}) will be shown in the behavior.

Many plugins will have no use for this event, and you should attempt to avoid using it if it is not necessary.

Some examples of valid uses for this event are:

  • Logging executed commands to a separate file
  • Variable substitution. For example, replacing ${ip:Steve} with the connection IP of the player named Steve, or simulating the @a and @p decorators used by Command Blocks for plugins that do not handle it.
  • Conditionally blocking commands belonging to other plugins.
  • Per-sender command aliases. For example, after the console runs the command /calias cr gamemode creative, the next time they run /cr, it gets replaced into /gamemode creative. (Global command aliases should be done by registering the alias.)

Examples of incorrect uses are:

  • Using this event to run command logic

If the event is cancelled, processing of the command will halt.

The state of whether or not there is a slash (/) at the beginning of the message should be preserved. If a slash is added or removed, unexpected behavior may result.
