classes.name: org.bukkit.plugin.messaging.Messenger
classes.comment_text:
A class responsible for managing the registrations of plugin channels and
 their listeners.

 Channel names must contain a colon separator and consist of only [a-z0-9/._-]
 - i.e. they MUST be valid {@link NamespacedKey}. The "BungeeCord" channel is
 an exception and may only take this form.

fields.name: MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE
fields.comment_text: Represents the largest size that an individual Plugin Message may be.

fields.name: MAX_CHANNEL_SIZE
fields.comment_text: Represents the largest size that a Plugin Channel may be.

methods.name: isReservedChannel
methods.comment_text: Checks if the specified channel is a reserved name.

methods.name: registerOutgoingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Registers the specific plugin to the requested outgoing plugin channel,
 allowing it to send messages through that channel to any clients.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that wishes to send messages through the channel.

methods.name: unregisterOutgoingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters the specific plugin from the requested outgoing plugin
 channel, no longer allowing it to send messages through that channel to
 any clients.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text:
Plugin that no longer wishes to send messages through the
     channel.

methods.name: unregisterOutgoingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters the specific plugin from all outgoing plugin channels, no
 longer allowing it to send any plugin messages.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that no longer wishes to send plugin messages.

methods.name: registerIncomingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Registers the specific plugin for listening on the requested incoming
 plugin channel, allowing it to act upon any plugin messages.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that wishes to register to this channel.

methods.name: unregisterIncomingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters the specific plugin's listener from listening on the
 requested incoming plugin channel, no longer allowing it to act upon
 any plugin messages.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that wishes to unregister from this channel.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.comment_text: Listener to stop receiving messages on.

methods.name: unregisterIncomingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters the specific plugin from listening on the requested
 incoming plugin channel, no longer allowing it to act upon any plugin
 messages.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that wishes to unregister from this channel.

methods.name: unregisterIncomingPluginChannel
methods.comment_text:
Unregisters the specific plugin from listening on all plugin channels
 through all listeners.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Plugin that wishes to unregister from this channel.

A registration is considered valid if it has not be unregistered and that the plugin is still enabled.

Checks if the specified plugin has registered to send outgoing messages

fields.comment_text: Outlines the entity so that it can be seen from afar.

fields.name: LEVITATION
fields.comment_text: Causes the entity to float into the air.

fields.name: LUCK
fields.comment_text: Loot table luck.

fields.name: UNLUCK
fields.comment_text: Loot table unluck.

fields.name: SLOW_FALLING
fields.comment_text: Slows entity fall rate.

fields.name: CONDUIT_POWER
fields.comment_text: Effects granted by a nearby conduit. Includes enhanced underwater abilities.

fields.name: DOLPHINS_GRACE
fields.comment_text: Squee'ek uh'k kk'kkkk squeek eee'eek.

 modifiers and checks.

Generally not to be used from within a plugin.

Returns an array of all the registered {@link PotionEffectType}s.

classes.name: org.bukkit.potion.PotionEffect
classes.comment_text:
Represents a potion effect, that can be added to a {@link LivingEntity}. A
 potion effect has a duration that it will last for, an amplifier that will
 enhance its effects, and a {@link PotionEffectType}, that represents its
 effect on an entity.

constructors.name: PotionEffect
constructors.comment_text: Creates a potion effect.

constructors.name: PotionEffect
constructors.comment_text: Creates a potion effect with no defined color.

constructors.name: PotionEffect
constructors.comment_text: Creates a potion effect. Assumes that particles are visible

constructors.name: PotionEffect
constructors.comment_text: Creates a potion effect. Assumes ambient is true.

constructors.name: PotionEffect
constructors.comment_text: Constructor for deserialization.

methods.name: apply
methods.comment_text:
Attempts to add the effect represented by this object to the given
 {@link LivingEntity}.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.comment_text: The entity to add this effect to

methods.name: getAmplifier
methods.comment_text:
Returns the amplifier of this effect. A higher amplifier means the
 potion effect happens more often over its duration and in some cases
 has more effect on its target.

methods.name: getDuration
methods.comment_text:
Returns the duration (in ticks) that this effect will run for when
 applied to a {@link LivingEntity}.

methods.name: getType
methods.comment_text: Returns the {@link PotionEffectType} of this effect.

methods.name: isAmbient
methods.comment_text: Makes potion effect produce more, translucent, particles.

constructors.name: PotionData
constructors.comment_text:
Instantiates a final PotionData object to contain information about a
 Potion

parameters.name: extended
parameters.comment_text:
whether the potion is extended PotionType#isExtendable()
 must be true

parameters.name: upgraded
parameters.comment_text:
whether the potion is upgraded PotionType#isUpgradable()
 must be true

methods.name: getType
methods.comment_text:
Gets the type of the potion, Type matches up with each kind of craftable
 potion

methods.name: isUpgraded
methods.comment_text:
Checks if the potion is in an upgraded state. This refers to whether or
 not the potion is Tier 2, such as Potion of Fire Resistance II.

methods.name: isExtended
methods.comment_text:
Checks if the potion is in an extended state. This refers to the extended
 duration potions

constructors.name: Potion
constructors.comment_text:
Construct a new potion of the given type. Unless the type is {@link
 PotionType#WATER}, it will be level one, without extended duration.
 Don't use this constructor to create a no-effect potion other than
 water bottle.

classes.name: org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitWorker
classes.comment_text:
Represents a worker thread for the scheduler. This gives information about the Thread object for the task, owner of the task and the taskId.

Workers are used to execute async tasks.

methods.comment_text: Returns the taskId for the task being executed by this worker.

methods.name: getOwner
methods.comment_text: Returns the Plugin that owns this task.

methods.name: getThread
methods.comment_text: Returns the thread for the worker.

parameters.comment_text: Delay in server ticks before executing task

This task will be executed by the main server thread.

Schedules a repeating task.

This task will be executed by the main server thread.

methods.name: scheduleAsyncDelayedTask
methods.comment_text:
Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

Schedules a once off task to occur after a delay. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.comment_text: Delay in server ticks before executing task

methods.name: scheduleAsyncDelayedTask
methods.comment_text:
Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

Schedules a once off task to occur as soon as possible. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

methods.name: scheduleAsyncRepeatingTask
methods.comment_text:
Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

Schedules a repeating task. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.comment_text: Delay in server ticks before executing first repeat

parameters.name: period
parameters.comment_text: Period in server ticks of the task

methods.name: callSyncMethod
methods.comment_text:
Calls a method on the main thread and returns a Future object. This task will be executed by the main server thread.
  • Note: The Future.get() methods must NOT be called from the main thread.
  • Note2: There is at least an average of 10ms latency until the isDone() method returns true.

methods.name: cancelTask
methods.comment_text: Removes task from scheduler.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.comment_text: Id number of task to be removed

methods.name: cancelTasks
methods.comment_text:
Removes all tasks associated with a particular plugin from the
 scheduler.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.comment_text: Owner of tasks to be removed

methods.name: isCurrentlyRunning
methods.comment_text:
Check if the task currently running.

A repeating task might not be running currently, but will be running in the future. A task that has finished, and does not repeat, will not be running ever again.

Explicitly, a task is running if there exists a thread for it, and that thread is alive.

methods.name: isQueued
methods.comment_text:
Check if the task queued to be run later.

If a repeating task is currently running, it might not be queued now but could be in the future. A task that is not queued, and not running, will not be queued again.

methods.name: getActiveWorkers
methods.comment_text:
Returns a list of all active workers.

This list contains asynch tasks that are being executed by separate threads.

methods.name: getPendingTasks
methods.comment_text:
Returns a list of all pending tasks. The ordering of the tasks is not
 related to their order of execution.

methods.comment_text: Returns a task that will run on the next server tick.

classes.name: org.bukkit.util.Vector
classes.comment_text: Represents a mutable vector. Because the components of Vectors are mutable, storing Vectors long term may be dangerous if passing code modifies the Vector later. If you want to keep around a Vector, it may be wise to call clone() in order to get a copy.

constructors.name: Vector
constructors.comment_text: Construct the vector with all components as 0.

constructors.name: Vector
constructors.comment_text: Construct the vector with provided integer components.

constructors.name: Vector
constructors.comment_text: Construct the vector with provided double components.

constructors.name: Vector
constructors.comment_text: Construct the vector with provided float components.

methods.name: add
methods.comment_text: Adds a vector to this one

methods.name: subtract
methods.comment_text: Subtracts a vector from this one.

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment_text: Multiplies the vector by another.

methods.name: divide
methods.comment_text: Divides the vector by another.

methods.name: copy
methods.comment_text: Copies another vector

methods.name: length
methods.comment_text:
Gets the magnitude of the vector, defined as sqrt(x^2+y^2+z^2). The
 value of this method is not cached and uses a costly square-root
 function, so do not repeatedly call this method to get the vector's
 magnitude. NaN will be returned if the inner result of the sqrt()
 function overflows, which will be caused if the length is too long.

methods.name: lengthSquared
methods.comment_text: Gets the magnitude of the vector squared.

methods.name: distance
methods.comment_text:
Get the distance between this vector and another. The value of this
 method is not cached and uses a costly square-root function, so do not
 repeatedly call this method to get the vector's magnitude. NaN will be
 returned if the inner result of the sqrt() function overflows, which
 will be caused if the distance is too long.

methods.name: distanceSquared
methods.comment_text: Get the squared distance between this vector and another.

methods.name: angle
methods.comment_text: Gets the angle between this vector and another in radians.

methods.name: midpoint
methods.comment_text: Sets this vector to the midpoint between this vector and another.

methods.name: getMidpoint
methods.comment_text: Gets a new midpoint vector between this vector and another.

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment_text:
Performs scalar multiplication, multiplying all components with a
 scalar.

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment_text:
Performs scalar multiplication, multiplying all components with a
 scalar.

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment_text:
Performs scalar multiplication, multiplying all components with a
 scalar.

methods.name: dot
methods.comment_text:
Calculates the dot product of this vector with another. The dot product
 is defined as x1*x2+y1*y2+z1*z2. The returned value is a scalar.

methods.name: crossProduct
methods.comment_text:
Calculates the cross product of this vector with another. The cross product is defined as:
  • x = y1 * z2 - y2 * z1
  • y = z1 * x2 - z2 * x1
  • z = x1 * y2 - x2 * y1

methods.name: getCrossProduct
methods.comment_text:
Calculates the cross product of this vector with another without mutating the original. The cross product is defined as:
  • x = y1 * z2 - y2 * z1
  • y = z1 * x2 - z2 * x1
  • z = x1 * y2 - x2 * y1

methods.name: normalize
methods.comment_text: Converts this vector to a unit vector (a vector with length of 1).

methods.name: zero
methods.comment_text: Zero this vector's components.

methods.name: isInAABB
methods.comment_text:
Returns whether this vector is in an axis-aligned bounding box.

The minimum and maximum vectors given must be truly the minimum and maximum X, Y and Z components.

methods.name: isInSphere
methods.comment_text: Returns whether this vector is within a sphere.

A vector with a hash function that floors the X, Y, Z components, a la
 BlockVector in WorldEdit. BlockVectors can be used in hash sets and
 hash maps. Be aware that BlockVectors are mutable, but it is important

methods.name: setScale
methods.comment_text:
Sets the scale used for all coordinates passed to this generator.

This is the equivalent to setting each coordinate to the specified value.
